text: Manda was determined to make a grand entrance this morning ‚Äî and he insisted upon a few redos until he got it just right! (Bonus points if you can spot little Mwinzi, resting against a nearby tree, who was avidly watching the whole spectacle!) Manda was rescued in December 2021. Likely a victim of the dry season or human-wildlife conflict, Manda was very gaunt and had clearly been on his own for some time. After a determined dash to restrain him, the team then had to carry him through the bush to the waiting helicopter ‚Äî which is no small task, when the cargo is a 1,000-pound elephant. Manda will remain in our care for many years, until he is ready to reclaim his place in the wild. You can become part of his journey by adopting him today! PLAINFIELD TOWNSHIP HOMICIDE UPDATE On 10/14/2023 at approximately 11:38 AM, deputies with the Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office were sent to a residence located near the 16200 block of S. Lincoln Highway in Unincorporated Plainfield Township regarding a stabbing that occurred involving a landlord and renter. When police personnel arrived on scene they located the suspect, Joseph M. Czuba (age 71) of Plainfield sitting upright outside on the ground near the driveway of the residence. Joseph Czuba had a laceration to his forehead and was later transported to a local area hospital for treatment. Deputies located two victims inside the residence in a bedroom. Both victims had multiple stab wounds to their chest, torso, and upper extremities. Both victims were transported to a local area hospital for treatment. The thirty-two (32) year-old female was transported in serious condition and had over a dozen stab wounds to her body. The female victim is recovering from her injuries at a local area hospital and is expected to survive this brutal attack. It was initially reported to police personnel that the juvenile victim was eight-years-old. That initial information was incorrect, and juvenile victim is six (6) years-old. The six-year-old male was transported to the hospital in critical condition. The boy later succumbed to his injuries and was pronounced deceased by a doctor. On 10/15/2023, an autopsy was conducted on the six-year-old victim. The forensic pathologist conducting the autopsy removed the knife from the abdomen of the boy at that time. The six-year-old boy was stabbed twenty-six (26) times throughout his body. The knife used in this attack is a twelve-inch serrated military style knife that has a seven-inch blade. The suspect, Joseph M. Czuba, was treated and released from a local area hospital and was transported to the Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office Public Safety Complex for questioning by detectives. Joseph Czuba did not make any statements to detectives regarding his involvement in this heinous attack. Despite the suspect not providing a statement to detectives, personnel were able to gather enough information through interviews and evidence to formally charge Joseph Czuba with numerous criminal offenses. Joseph Czuba was charged with First Degree Murder, Attempted First Degree Murder, Hate Crime (2 counts), and Aggravated Battery with a Deadly Weapon. Detectives were able to determine that both victims in this brutal attack were targeted by the suspect due to them being Muslim and the on-going Middle Eastern conflict involving Hamas and the Israelis. The Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office would like to thank the Will County State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office for their assistance in working with detectives regarding Joseph Czuba being formally charged in this senseless and cowardly act of violence. Joseph Czuba was transported to the Will County Adult Detention Facility and is awaiting his initial court appearance.

Fiji Airways Clarifies Israel Charter Operation Nadi, 16 October 2023 - Fiji Airways wishes to address certain concerns raised in the media regarding the operation of the recent charter flight to Israel. Fiji Airways would like to emphasise that the decision to operate the charter flight to Israel was based on purely commercial considerations. Following the recent delivery of two (2) new A350 aircraft into the Fiji Airways fleet, the airline has some excess wide-body aircraft time available, and operating charter flights is one way to utilise this excess aircraft time to generate additional revenue. Fiji Airways has an established business relationship with the charterer of the Israel charter flight, who has a history of operating successful international charters, and making timely payments for previous charter services. Whilst the terms of the charter agreement are confidential between Fiji Airways and the charterer, we can confirm that the charter is of commercial benefit to Fiji Airways. Fiji Airways would also like to clarify that at no point did any Government Minister or other Government official exert any undue influence or pressure on the airline to operate this charter. The decision was made independently by Fiji Airways. Fiji Airways does not operate on the basis of political or religious favoritism. We treat all of our customers and charterers equally, and the decision to operate this charter was solely a business decision. Fiji Airways is proud of its collaborative effort with the Government to safely repatriate our fellow Fijians from Israel. We would like to take this opportunity to publically acknowledge the Fiji Airways pilots and crew who operated this significant flight. Our thoughts and prayers are with the innocent victims of the ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine.

Palestina Ik probeer al een tijdje onder woorden te brengen hoe ik me voel over de gebeurtenissen in Palestina. Wetende dat zoveel mensen deze pagina volgen, probeer ik altijd zo goed mogelijk mijn verantwoordelijkheid te nemen om een gebeurtenis en harde realiteit juist en correct te bespreken. Tegelijkertijd vraag ik me af waarom ik de behoefte voel om iets op social media te plaatsen. Heeft het enige meerwaarde. Draag ik bij aan het aankaarten van iets, of is het eerder een onbewuste ego√Østische poging om me te ontdoen van mijn onmacht en woede die ik voel. Wat ik zeker niet wil, is dat het voor mij en jullie een angst wordt om er iets over te zeggen. Angst omdat het altijd duidelijk is geweest en alleen maar duidelijker wordt: steun voor onschuldige Palestijnse kinderen en families wordt te vaak gezien als een anti-Isra√´l boodschap. Waardoor we niets meer zeggen en we in alle stilte meekijken hoe een volk verdwijnt. Je zou denken dat het vreemd is, maar het zou je verbazen hoe we tot het punt zijn gekomen van angst. Angst om rechtvaardigheid en menselijkheid op te eisen voor een volk dat decennialang systematisch wordt onderdrukt, vermoord, weggedreven uit hun huizen en land. Een man in een moskee vertelde me eergisteren dat er met geen woord werd gerept over Palestina voor het gebed. Volgens hem heerst er een grote angst dat de deuren van de moskee door de overheid worden gesloten als er enige steun wordt uitgesproken naar het Palestijnse volk, opgevangen door inlichtingendiensten. Want daar zijn we beland: angstig om bezorgd te zijn om een volk, angst om het oneens te zijn met een politiek ten opzichte van een volk, angst om het woord "Palestina" uit te spreken alsof het je schuldig verklaart om tegen de burgers van Isra√´l te zijn. Alsof het onmogelijk is om empathie te hebben voor onschuldige Isra√´lische burgers en slachtoffers en ook kritisch te zijn ten opzichte van een politiek. Veel social media-platforms wissen accounts en berichten van steun aan de Palestijnen. Palestijnse vlaggen van burgers worden uit steden verwijderd. Sommige landen verbieden pro-Palestina manifestaties in hun steden. Het is zo ver gekomen dat steun voor een onschuldig Palestijns volk wordt gereduceerd tot het haten van het Isra√´lische volk. Het tegendeel is waar: het leven van onschuldige mensen heeft overal waarde. Maar tot mijn grote (niet verbazing) teleurstelling niet voor iedereen. En misschien niet voor de mensen die hier heel veel invloed op hebben of kunnen hebben. De politieke klasse. Vele media. En juist daarom raakt de reactie, buiten alle proportie, van een democratische regering en leger op een afschuwelijke aanslag miljoenen onschuldige Palestijnen en laat het velen, mezelf inclusief, achter met woede. Meer dan dat, we kijken allemaal naar onze regeringen die carte blanche geven om wraak te nemen op onschuldige mensen die al generaties lang onderdrukt, vermoord, weggejaagd van hun huizen en landen, en gestraft worden omdat ze gewoonweg bestaan en van hun bestaansrecht dromen. Ik kan op veel vlakken fout zijn, onwetend, verward of zoekend, maar niet over mijn gevoel dat dit fout is. Verkeerd. Oneerlijk. Als kind hebben we thuis de strijd van het Palestijnse volk al zo lang gevolgd als ik me kan herinneren. Onze ouders hebben, via de satelliet, beelden van het conflict en het lijden tientallen jaren lang naar binnen gebracht. Ik schreef mijn novelle "Als je iemand verliest die je niet kan verliezen" over een Palestijnse man die zijn familie is verloren, omdat ik het nooit hier hoorde of las. Ik las of hoorde nooit hoe het voelde voor hen in onze literaire boeken, films, tv-programma's, debatten of het nieuws. Ik las enkel een statistiek en dan de al te vaak gebruikte argumenten die beginnen met "ja maar...", alsof alles toelaatbaar was als het ging om hen. Ik ben niet iemand die advies geeft, maar ik sta mezelf toe er √©√©n te geven. Als je echt geeft om de situatie in Palestina en Isra√´l. Als je echt geraakt bent en je zorgen maakt, leer er dan over. Leer over de geschiedenis. Vertrouw niet op de mening van wie dan ook, mezelf incluis, of een stukje uit een tv-debat om tot conclusies te komen. Dus ja, mijn hart gaat uit naar de miljoenen Palestijnen die al zo lang lijden, vanwege de directe impact van bommen, geweren, pesterijen en ontheemding van hun huizen, en de teleurstelling van een wereld die doet alsof het niet zo erg is als het lijkt. En ja, dit kan geschreven worden en tegelijkertijd ook geraakt en bedroefd zijn om de onschuldige Isra√´lische mensen die hun levens hebben verloren of slachtoffer zijn geweest van iets dat hen hun leven lang zal meevolgen. Als de twijfel daarover het startpunt is van een debat of tegen argument, dan kan het gesprek helaas niet verder. Deze situatie is er geen van argumenten en tegen argumenten. Deze situatie is er een van een realiteit: het wordt toegelaten. Het meest afschuwelijke wordt toegelaten. Decennia lang. Ish

AFFECTIONATE PERO WALANG LABEL Hello, manghihingi sana ako ng advice, pero bago yon, kuwento ko muna kung ano ang happenings. Medyo mahaba ito. There's this guy na kagrupo ko sa thesis, hindi kami close nong una, pero habang nakakasama ko siya sa paggawa ng thesis ay napapalapit ang loob ko sa kanya. Until I started to have a crush on him last month. Sa thesis group kasi namin, madalas good vibes at (humorous) asaran ang nangyayari, tapos don ako sa asaran namin na-fall. HAHA! Kapag inaasar niya ako, inaasar ko rin siya. Safe naman kasi parehas kaming walang jowa (NBSB ako and I think NGSB rin siya, base lang sa aking research. HAHAHA!). Parehas din kasi kaming introvert at taong bahay. Tapos ito, feeling ko may something din siya para sa akin, e. Kapag gumagawa kami ng manuscript, madalas niya akong tabihan at minsan sinasandalan niya rin ako. May times na nagkakasabay kami pauwi dahil kaming dalawa yong parehas ng way, at kapag umuulan ay nakiki-share siya sa kin ng payong kahit may payong din siyang dala. Kapag nagyaya akong maglakad, sumasama siya. May isang beses na nasa tricycle kami, tapos ako naman ang naglakas-loob na sumandal sa balikat niya. His response? Sinandal niya rin ang ulo niya sa ulo ko, tapos nilagay niya yong kamay niya sa tuhod ko. After that, may dalawang beses na muntik na niya akong akbayan habang naglalakad kami, kaso binabawi niya, e. Marami na rin kaming naging group overnights para sa thesis at ganon pa rin, tinatabihan niya ako at inaasar. Tapos, kapag nagbabalot ako ng kumot kasi madali akong lamigin sa aircon, nakiki-share din siya sa kumot ko habang gumagawa kami ng manuscript. May times na dinidikit niya yong binti niya sa binti ko o di kaya ay ipapatong niya ang kamay niya sa tuhod ko. Hinahayaan ko naman siya kasi comfortable naman ako na kinikilig deep inside. HAHAHA! O di ba, feeling ko mag-jowa na kami kasi ang close namin physically. But, here comes the conflict. Kapag nag-uusap kaming dalawa ay tungkol lang din sa thesis or something related. Yong asaran namin ay nangyayari lang kapag kasama namin ang groupmates namin. Once ay nagkakuwentuhan naman kaming dalawa about sa mga nababasa naming stories kasi parehas kaming reader, pero magkaiba ng medium kasi siya sa manga, ako naman sa novel. Parang yon lang ang napag-usapan namin na tungkol sa amin. Hindi ko alam kung paano ko siya kakausapin personally, at hindi rin naman siya nag-i-initiate ng ganong convo. About thesis and school stuff lang talaga ang napapag-usapan. Minsan nga, as in tahimik lang kaming magkasama pauwi. Same thing sa chats. Hindi humahaba ang convo namin, saka minsan ang tagal din kasi niyang mag-reply, tapos ang dry ng messages niya. Tapos, kapag hindi kami gumagawa ng thesis, like papasok lang sa school ganon, bihira niya akong pansinin. Napapaisip tuloy ako na baka wala naman pala talaga siyang feelings para sa kin. Naguguluhan na ako kung ano ba tong meron sa pagitan namin, or kung meron ba talaga. Tingin niyo ba, dapat ko na siyang i-confront? I really like him. Tatanggapin ko kahit anong kalalabasan ng pag-uusap namin, gusto ko lang talagang malinawan. Kaso iniisip ko, baka hindi lang talaga siya ready at matakot ko. Hindi rin ako sanay sa confrontation, baka maiyak ako, iyakin pa naman ako kapag nag-overflow na ang feelings. HAHAHA! What do you think? Too soon for a confession, or i-push ko na? INFP 20** *Confidential *** Send your stories/confessions here: www.usfstories.com:=:https://usfstories.com/

Kakaibang Gamutan sa Stress at Nerbyos Payo ni Doc Willie Ong 1. Relaxation Therapy - Ang relaxation therapy ay magagawa sa pamamagitan ng paghinga ng mabagal at malalim, pagmumuni-muni at pagpapalakas ng katawan. 2. Masahe - May mga pag-aaral na ang pagpapa-masahe ay nakatutulong para kontrolin ang stress at pagkabalisa sa pamamagitan ng pagpaparelax ng muscles at pagpapakalma ng iyong isip. 3. Aromatherapy - Ang aromatherapy ay ginagamitan ng langis na nagmumula sa iba't ibang halaman para gamutin ang sakit. May paniniwala na ang compunds sa langis ay binubuhay ang ilang mga kemikal sa utak na mayroong pangpa-relax na epekto. 4. Art Therapy - Ang pag-drawing, painting, clay at sculpture ay makatutulong ipahayag ang mga saloobin at emosyon kung mahirap para sa kanila ang pag-usapan ito. 5. Music at pagkanta - Ang pakikinig sa musika, pagkanta at paglalaro ng musical instruments ay naka-re-relax at nagpapa-kalma. 6. Yoga - Ang regular na pagyo-yoga ay makatutulong bawasan ang pang araw-araw na stress at pagkabalisa. Kundalini yoga, isang klase ng yoga na napag-aralan para sa pagkabalisa, samahan ng pagpose ng katawan at technique sa paghinga.

Unforgiveness causes conflict and creates obstacles in your relationship with God. It also undermines your connection with Him and sets you against those who could assist you. Forgiveness is the ultimate key to a life filled with power. One's ability to forgive quickly is a clear indicator of their knowledge of God. Whenever you seek God's mercy, He instructs you to begin with forgiveness. Unforgiveness leads to a failure of grace and inflicts more harm than the devil ever could. Unforgiveness tarnishes your grace amidst blessings. Inability to forgive signifies a lack of understanding of God, as Christianity is founded on forgiveness. Unforgiveness squanders offerings and sacrifices and perpetuates poverty. It hinders your access to financial blessings. Unresolved conflicts among individuals lead to conflicts between you and God. Bitterness is unproductive, and no one is deserving of hatred. Unforgiveness blinds you to any goodness in others. Genuine forgiveness is evident when you harbor goodwill, are willing to reconcile, abstain from gossip and revisiting past offenses, extend kindness, and think and speak positively about those who have wronged you. When you continue to act and live as you did before, never harboring resentment, it reflects true forgiveness.

There are a lot of questions around the war in Israel, and a lot of justified panic. One of the issues directly affecting Americans is how the war will influence the price of gas. Here‚Äôs Five Fast Facts About The War in Israel and Gas Prices: üìà Bump - The first Monday after the war began, global oil prices jumped by 4%. It was back to normal by the end of that week. üìâ Down In It - Even when you factor in that slight hop, oil prices are still down about 6% from September of last year. üçÅ Falling in Fall - Even better, if there is an increase in prices at the pump, it‚Äôs likely to be overridden by the usual decline in gas prices in the fall. Less people traveling for vacations means less cars filling up, and that causes prices to drop. üìä But Wait - There is a ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù situation that needs to be factored into the equation. If the war is expanded to surrounding regions and includes other allies, prices could increase. Emphasis on the word ‚Äúcould.‚Äù üö¢ But Why? - Hamas, the terrorist group that carried out the attacks on Israel, is allegedly funded by Iran. There is no evidence as of this writing that Iran is involved. However, Iran is an oil producer and controls passage through the Strait of Hormuz, a route for about 15% of global oil supply. If conflict breaks out, that route could be impacted. üî•Bottom line: The short answer is that you don‚Äôt need to worry about gas prices increasing. Hopefully the war in Israel ends soon and we don‚Äôt need to worry about any part of this horrific situation. Attachment theory is so much more than knowing your attachment style‚Ä¶.it‚Äôs a theory about learning to connect and using the power of connection as a way for partners to reach each other‚Ä¶.secure attachment is about maximizing connection and every interaction between partners, even the smallest, provides an opportunity for connection. Insecure attachment represents a lack of connection to self the difficulty connecting to your partner. What is connection? Connection is a feeling of closeness and safety, a sharing of selves. Even during conflict, partners can learn to maintain connection. Even when your partner is acting out of fear, you can still do your part to maintain connection. Even when you are acting out of fear, your partner can still do their part to maintain connection. How do you connect? Listening, validation, empathy, understanding, co-regulation, setting healthy boundaries, communicating your wants and needs with connection in mind, and respond to your partner‚Äôs wants and needs with connection in mind. üîôHow Olamide threatened Don Jazzy not to step foot on the Lagos ‚ÄòMainland following their clash at the annual Headies Awards ceremony in 2015. The biggest record label w@r and conflict resolution in Afrobeat's history. Olamide was so furious, that he declared war publicly. It all started when Reekado Banks (who was formerly signed to MAVIN Records)was announced the winner of Headies ‚ÄúNext Rated Award,‚Äù at the 2015 Headies Awards. This didn't go down well with Olamide (The Founder of YBNL Nation which has produced artists like; - Asake, Fireboy, Adekunle Gold...) Olamide climbed the Stage with his entire YBNL team and sent a powerful message, declaring Lil Kesh, the winner, according, to Baddosneh he said, ‚ÄúLil Kesh is our own Next Rated artist. F**k that sh*t! The streets ti take over. Every f**k!ng single was a hit back to back.‚Äù He dropped the mic in anger, leaving the stage with his YBNL squad while spilling his drink. Don Jazzy (The founder of MAVIN Records, which has produced stars like, Wande Coal, Tiwa Savage, Rema, Ayra Starr...) responded to Baddo's rant in a calm speech that said ‚ÄúEgbon Olamide, if you want the car, come and collect it‚Äù Afterward, Olamide came for Don Jazzy on X ( formerly Twitter) In several tweets Baddo declared war on Don Jazzy and even warned him not to step foot on the Mainland in Lagos. A similar warning reminds us of the already-seen feud that started the bl00*dy war between the late Tupac Shakur and Notorious BIG. His words ‚Äú‚Ä¶. Don‚Äôt f**k!ng come to the Mainland. Honestly, fu**k you, I am f**king Mainland‚Äù He also dragged Don Baba for how he treated his artists under MAVIN. Don Jazzy was very smart and saw what a war between the two biggest Recording labels across Africa would have led to. And he tendered a public apology to the YBNL family. It was later revealed in 2016 that Aliko Dangote settled the beef between Olamide & Don Jazzy after they clashed at the Headies in 2015 over the Next Rated Awards. Don Jazzy later expressed how he regretted his actions. As stated by him "It was out of character. I regretted that instantly as soon as I came down from the stage. I apologized to the Headies organizers and Olamide as well."

What if every time we disagreed with someone, we took it as an invitation to a spiritual journey? Every disagreement, a stepping stone; every contrasting opinion, a guidepost leading us toward a greater understanding of this vast, complex universe, and our place within it. Let me pause here to clarify something vital: Understanding and love have their boundaries. There is no place in our quest for unity for hate speech, misinformation, or any form of injustice. These are the antithesis of enlightenment and unity; they're spiritual roadblocks, obstacles in our collective journey towards a higher realm of existence. You see, my friends, we often forget that each person is a world unto themselves, forged by experiences and understandings that we may know nothing of. The Lubavitcher Rebbe taught us that love is not about finding someone you can live with; it's about finding someone you can't imagine living without. What if we applied that kind of love universally? A love so encompassing that we couldn't imagine our world without even those we disagree with. In the words of the wisest King Solomon, "Iron sharpens iron, and one man sharpens another." We often take this to mean conflict or friction, but what if we saw it as the creation of a spark? A divine spark that only comes into being when two opposing forces strive not for victory but for enlightenment, to understand and to be understood. When we disagree yet strive to understand, we're not weakening our own standpoint; we're elevating the whole discussion into a higher realm, one closer to the unity that underpins all of existence. And who knows, perhaps in that sacred space, you'll not only come to understand the person standing opposite you but also catch a glimpse of the Divine. May your words be bridges, may your understanding be a beacon that can guide and inspire others, and may your love for every soul guide you closer to the ultimate unity we all seek.

I wrote a post about myself, an adult, not freaking out when my children said things that were factually incorrect because I knew they were playing at having that skill. Like pretending to read a sign, or drawing scribbles and then ‚Äúreading‚Äù them to me. The point of my post was that I don‚Äôt need to correct my children constantly in play and tell them ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not actually what that says‚Äù or things like that, because‚Ä¶they‚Äôre playing. They‚Äôre learning. Me correcting them only disrupts our relationship, the thing they were hoping to share with me. Someone asked, very reasonably so, in the comments about what to do with this when *you*, the adult, know how to go unbothered‚Ä¶but an older sibling doesn‚Äôt know how to let their younger sibling be ‚Äúwrong‚Äù without being bothered. Because the older sibling is coming from a childish and limited perspective too, and they can‚Äôt see that the little one is playing‚Ä¶all they can see is that they‚Äôre WRONG! This was my answer: I don't know how old the sibs are, but I *was* this older sibling my entire life. It felt very frustrating to feel like I knew that something was literally wrong, incorrect, factually untrue, lying, etc...and for the adults around me to brush it off as if it didn't matter. I mean, maybe in adult terms it *didn't* matter -- and obviously I didn't understand child development of my little siblings! -- but to me it felt like ‚ÄúWhat the heck, I value truth and justice and accuracy, why is no one else around me valuing it too????‚Äù I wonder whether "leaning in" to that with your older child might help? You could pull them aside to talk about it somewhere where it's not bothering little sib, keep patiently listening and empathizing, and then offer suggestions based on the specific situation after they truly feel heard. I wonder if they feel like they have to be the one ‚Äúholding down the fort‚Äù ‚Äî enforcing truth and justice and accuracy -- since it might seem to them like the adults around them don't care. (Even though you obviously do care! Since you're asking me! But that might not reflect their feelings.) Like the more you say ‚Äújust let it go,‚Äù they have to dig in even harder, because to them, the world obviously has a Right and a Wrong and if the adults won‚Äôt even care about that or see that, then they just have to entrench themselves even further in it to make sure that at least *somebody* is protecting the Right and the Wrong. Maybe if they felt super duper listened to and like you took what they were saying was important...like...10x as much as you tell them why it's actually *not* important...then maybe they wouldn't feel like they have to be the enforcer of it as much, and they'd lay off younger sib after awhile? Mine are pretty young -- 5 and 3 -- and both have slightly or moderately delayed language skills, so my direct experience in this as a parent is limited. But I do a lot of echoing back to each of my kids what they're saying, and accept that they might still be in conflict after that, or they might move on. Apollo gets super offended that Summer is not actually reading correctly, for example. S: That says "Summer!" Me: Oh, yeah? A: It does NOT. That is G. That says "guh". S: NOOOO! S FOR SUMMER!! Me: Oh, yeah, you're right, Apollo. It is a G, you learned that at school huh? S: It's S for Summer! Me: Oh Summer you're thinking of how the first letter in your name is an S? S: Yeah!!! A: That says G!! Like grape!!! Me: Oh yeah, G is the first letter in grape! Good thinking!! ...etc, etc. It does get exhausting, and it's not like the two of them resolved the conflict or even really understood what each other was talking about, but it's like I held two conversations at once to try to affirm what each of them was doing (one of them being factually correct; the other one playing, and being sort of correct, just in different ways.) Because neither of them are doing anything wrong. They‚Äôre just not currently doing the same thing, and they don‚Äôt have the skills yet to recognize that the other person might be doing something else and shift their play to match that. It‚Äôs part of a broader theme when my kids fight of reminding myself that I‚Äôm on nobody‚Äôs side (or to put it more positively, that we‚Äôre *all* a team). I am neither on ‚ÄúTeam Protect the Younger Sib Who‚Äôs Just Playing‚Äù nor am I on ‚ÄúTeam Side with the Older Sib who‚Äôs Factually Correct‚Äù. My goal is to make sure that both of them feel like they are understood by me, even if they‚Äôre not by one another, since I can‚Äôt manage their relationship with one another, only their relationship with me.

Whether we like it or not, as born again believers, we were all made for WAR! The moment you and I got saved and filled with the Holy Spirit, was the exact moment that the enemy, the devil and all of his evil cohorts, placed a target on our backs. And the Bible is very clear about the domain in which that warfare takes place and it is not as we all suppose. We look at what is happening all around the world, and we assume that we are fighting terrorists, criminals, war-lords, witch doctors, politicians, globalists, bankers, economists, government officials, in-laws and out-laws, to name but a few. But the truth is, we are not. Our fight is NOT against flesh and blood but against demonic spirits that operate in the realm of the spirit! Jesus says something quite interesting in Matthew chapter 11 and verse 12: ‚ÄúAnd from the days of John the Baptist until now the kingdom of heaven suffers violence, and the VIOLENT take it by force.‚Äù (Matthew 11:12 NKJV) In others words, Jesus is saying, ‚ÄúYes, there is trouble in this world and there is conflict talking place, but it‚Äôs not a conflict that is being waged in the natural realm as much as it is in the spiritual realm. In other words, it‚Äôs a spiritual kingdom that suffers spiritual violence. But it‚Äôs the spiritually VIOLENT that oppose and resist it and take what is rightfully theirs, by force.‚Äù And He is looking for a generation who are willing to see the world that we're living in and decide that they're not going to give one more inch to the enemy; that it‚Äôs time to take back what the enemy has stolen from us. I promise you, our God is able, if we are willing to stand up and declare, "Enough is enough"! Once again, we are so looking forward to seeing you all at our 8am and 10:30am services. I believe that bondages and strongholds are going to be dismantled and destroyed as we gather together in His Presence. Her Seductive, Charismatic Figure...... A summary of Cleopatra's life: Cleopatra was born in 69 BC in Alexandria, Egypt, and she was a member of the Ptolemaic dynasty. She became Queen of Egypt at a young age, co-ruling with her father and later with her younger brothers. Cleopatra was known for her intelligence, charisma, and fluency in multiple languages. She had romantic relationships with two of the most prominent Romans of her time, Julius Caesar and Mark Antony. These relationships played a significant role in the politics of the Roman Republic. She was a shrewd diplomat and used her alliances with Caesar and Antony to secure Egypt's interests. After the death of Julius Caesar, she aligned herself with Mark Antony and had three children with him. However, her relationship with Mark Antony ultimately led to conflict with Octavian (later known as Augustus), the eventual first Roman Emperor. The Battle of Actium in 31 BC marked a decisive defeat for Antony and Cleopatra. Rather than being captured by her Roman adversaries, Cleopatra took her own life, possibly by being bitten by an asp, in 30 BC. With her death, Egypt was annexed by the Roman Empire, ending the Ptolemaic rule. Cleopatra's life and dramatic relationships with powerful Roman figures have made her an enduring and iconic historical figure, and her legacy continues to captivate the imagination through literature, art, and film. POSITION PAPER It took us a week to formulate this statement. We are a movement made up of Jewish and Arab women with diverse opinions and positions, and we found ourselves inside this crazy, threatening, horrible and frightening movie. There are no words in any language to describe what we all went through this past week. We are still searching for the right words that we can share at this moment. First of all, we mourn the brutal murder, in an indescribable and unforgiveable massacre carried out by Hamas, of over 1300 civilians, babies, children, women, men, the elderly, male and female soldiers, members of the security and rescue forces, among them Arab civilians and soldiers. We wish complete recovery and rehabilitation to the thousands injured in body and soul. We share the deep sorrow of members of Women Wage Peace who lost family members; we offer support to the members of the movement from the Gaza Envelope who survived the horrific inferno last Saturday; and we are terribly worried about the safety and fate of all those missing, kidnapped and abducted ‚Äì among them peace activist Vivian Silver from Kibbutz Beeri, a member of Women Wage Peace, and Ditza Heyman from Kibbutz Nir Oz, the mother of movement member, Neta Heiman. We demand that the Israeli government begin negotiations immediately for the release of all those who were abducted. We call on the Red Cross and the international community to ensure their safety and act for their immediate release. Despite the rage and pain in the face of the criminal and unforgiveable acts committed by Hamas, including incessant shelling of towns all over Israel, we must not lose human dignity. Even in the most difficult situations, it is our obligation as mothers, as women, as human beings and as an entire nation not to lose basic human values. We hear words of revenge all the time ‚Äì ‚Äúall restraints have been removed‚Äù, ‚Äúwe will wipe out Gaza‚Äù, ‚Äúwe will act brutally‚Äù. But one cannot resolve one injustice with another injustice. We grieve the death of innocent Palestinians, among them hundreds of children, who are being killed in this accursed war. The situation in Gaza is getting worse all the time. This war proves, more than ever, that the concept of ‚Äúmanaging the conflict‚Äù failed. The idea that dealing with the resolution of the conflict could be postponed indefinitely has been proved to be fundamentally wrong. For 9 years since the end of ‚ÄúOperation Protective Edge‚Äù, we, Jewish and Arab mothers have been telling the leadership in Israel ‚Äì enough! We must turn every stone in order to reach a political solution. This is our obligation for the future of our children. This is our obligation to both Israeli and Palestinian children. They deserve a future of security and freedom, not a future of death, war and destruction. Despite the complexity of the issue, we and the Palestinians have no choice but to strive for a resolution of the conflict. The Palestinian people will not disappear, nor will we. More wars, bombings, assassinations, arrests and a never-ending cycle of bloodshed will not allow us and our children to live here as normal people. All conflicts in the world have been resolved by peace agreements. Hamas acts to destroy any chance for peace. Hamas has already managed to destroy the negotiations with Saudi Arabia. Hamas must not be allowed to win! We know these words sound imaginary, na√Øve and unrealistic, but this is the truth, and we must recognize it. Every mother, Jewish and Arab, gives birth to her children to see them grow and flourish and not to bury them. That‚Äôs why, even today, amidst the pain and the feeling that the belief in peace has collapsed, we extend a hand in peace to the mothers of Gaza and the West Bank. We mothers, together with women from all over the world, must unite to stop this madness. It is our obligation to say, even if it is difficult to say this now ‚Äì Israel must consider its steps and actions responsibly and morally and prevent needless deaths of civilians and soldiers and, at the same time, wherever possible, prevent harm to innocent people in Gaza. We raise difficult questions and expect answers ‚Äì ground action, destruction of Gaza, forcing one million Palestinians to flee their homes ‚Äì will all of this lead to a future of security? And what will happen the day after? Isn‚Äôt it essential to deal with the issue of the abductees first? Do our leaders have the answers? We must maintain and strengthen the solidarity and unity between the Jewish and Arab public in Israel and continue to act against racism and hatred. The Arab public, which has lived for years with the internal conflict of being citizens of Israel and being part of the Palestinian people, rallied in this difficult time of crisis for the sake of the entire society in Israel. We demand that Israel prevent a flare-up in the West Bank and not allow extremist elements from both sides to incite the region, as has already happened this past week. Last (truncated)

Ares Ares in Greek mythology was the god of war and violence. More specifically, he was associated with ‚Äúthe most objectionable aspects of war‚Äù,with violence and conflict for its own sake. Unlike his counterpart, the war goddess Athena, Ares did not represent strategy or heroic ethics; rather, he embodied the destructive and cruel side of war. 2nd-century AD Roman sculpture after a Greek original Louvre Museum

üì∑: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken meets with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi at Al-Ittihadiya Palace in Cairo, Egypt, Oct. 15, 2023. üëâ Egypt's president criticized Israel‚Äôs military operation in Gaza in a stern pushback Sunday to the United States as America's top diplomat extended his frenetic travels across the Mideast trying to prevent the war with Hamas from igniting a broader regional conflict. With an Israeli ground offensive looming, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken reaffirmed in some of his strongest language to date that Washington would stand with Israel ‚Äútoday, tomorrow and every day‚Äù in a partnership of shared democratic values, but that Israel must take ‚Äúevery possible precaution to avoid harming civilian.‚Äù He leveled no direct public criticism of Israel or its bombing campaign that has killed civilians in Gaza. From Cairo, where President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi conveyed his criticism, Blinken went to Jordan and planned to return to Israel on Monday, carrying to Israeli leaders the feedback he received in a rush of meetings with leaders throughout the Arab world. His second visit to Israel in recent days will come amid heightening fears that a looming Israeli move into Gaza could spark a wider war with devastating humanitarian consequences, a growing concern for the Biden administration. Egypt‚Äôs state-run media said el-Sisi told Blinken that Israel‚Äôs Gaza operation has exceeded ‚Äúthe right of self-defense‚Äù and turned into ‚Äúa collective punishment." Blinken told reporters before leaving Egypt that ‚ÄúIsrael has the right, indeed it has the obligation to defend itself against these attacks from Hamas and to try to do what it can to make sure that this never happens again." Mindful of the potential human cost in Gaza, Blinken said "the way that Israel does this matters. It needs to do it in a way that affirms the shared values that we have for human life and human dignity, taking every possible precaution to avoid harming civilians.‚Äô‚Äô (AP) https://www.voanews.com/a/israel-increases-readiness-for-massive-ground-assault-on-gaza/7311602.html

Good afternoon folks , During this years Market Garden Commemorations we not only enjoyed a magnificent audience, we were heading towards the number of 28,000 followers. It might seem strange to you guys and ladies that follow us , but it must be remembered that as a page or group we have only been in existence for the past eight or nine years in total . Darren , my son and founder has been into Living History since he was sixteen. But having started out with ‚ÄúThe Acorn Gunners‚Äù He then founded ‚ÄúThe Far Setting Sun‚Äù with current Admin Simon Tierney. But since his early interest in Living History his true interest was always with The British Airborne Forces and is still as strong to this present day . A trip to Arnhem found us Paul Dutton whose expertise is The Royal Army Medical Corp . Both Darren & Paul took what is now our Jeep to Arnhem and they both enjoyed a very warm reception from the Dutch everywhere they appeared . We not only have Dutch admins Alex de Groot and Ernst Peters on board with us we also have Dutch Patron Jennifer van Venrooij-eisinger who over the past two years assists Patron Beverley Cooper when she represents The Arnhem Boys . Admin Nobby Clark a wizard with Jeeps is also a font of knowledge on The Airborne Recce and shares his time as the Official Standard Bearer for The Recce Association. Nobby also regularly accompanies us on show dates where with his MOD Training he takes our younger audiences through WW2 weaponry which over the last two years has become extremely successful with the youngsters and their parents, whose permission we always seek first . The name Living History brings to mind mock battles in period uniform etc . But as we‚Äôre growing we have become more of an educational group combined as an open air museum, depending on the location of each venue . We are fortunate to have a number of high profile Patrons who support our cause and on occasions come to events as well as we enjoy a huge following in Holland where we have over the years of attending the Dutch commemorations added to The Arnhem Boys Collection of genuine artefacts recovered from the areas of Arnhem and Oosterbeek. We have new members whom you‚Äôve already read posts from , Scott Goring , another Living history man who has his own Airborne Jeep & trailer a WW2 Motor cycle and his own collection of kit . A Mr. Jack Scott and like our Nobby has two Jeeps one of which is coming to fruition as a full Airborne Jeep. Our own Jeep is finished now as a full Airborne Jeep and her last excursion out to Bradwell Waterside saw her for the first time without her windscreen on and carrying her genuine Vickers K atop her scaffold Mount . BUT,‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.For all our achievements our aim will always have a direct affiliation with why Darren chose the name we carry . People ask us why The Arnhem Boys ??. A lot of thought went into it‚Äôs being . There were so many different cap badges worn during Operation Market Garden. Each one entitled to be called Arnhem Boys . Hence our name as so many Regiments fought side by side and fought with honour and distinction. All those badges form what we know today as the veterans of that conflict . Our motto which is carried on our badge is what our aims are as a group , ‚Äú Keeping Our Past In Our Future ‚Äú ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ The happy birthday posts for Ron Johnson I looked at last night before I went to bed 47.1K and nearly 2.0K shares. I asked a question the other day on how many of our veterans are still with us ? . Obviously with each year they get fewer as the natural aging factor affects us all ‚Ä¶ But those wonderful men will achieve something that none of us mere mortals ever will . As participants in Market Garden in their passing they‚Äôll attain immortality. Long after they‚Äôve gone students of history will learn about the conflicts they fought in . They‚Äôll read of individual names associated with the battle ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶men like Steve Morgan last man on the bridge . Many of our followers watched as Darren carried Steve‚Äôs ashes on their final journey back to Arnhem to lie with his fallen comrades in Oosterbeek Cemetery. As onlookers you couldn‚Äôt possibly know what was going through Darren‚Äôs mind . On that occasion he wore the shirt of 2 Para in honour of the warrior he was carrying in a special flask on his back . A whip aerial strapped to his back flying the flag . Darren was asked by so many of the veterans if he would personally take them home to their final resting place . This he achieved all but one, ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶which was taken out of his hands . The dedication and rapore Darren had with many of our past veterans has helped make the reputation we enjoy to this present day . With this post Im including a video Darren dedicates to Steve Morgan . Steve produced a booklet which if you haven‚Äôt read it , I urge you all to do so. This message or post is from all of us here on The Arnhem Boys. Please keep liking the posts and thank you so much for your continued support ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ As a postscript four Patrons this year (truncated)

üì∑: Palestinians line up as they wait to fill cans with fuel, amid shortages of fuel, as the Israeli-Palestinian conflict continues, at a petrol station in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, Oct. 15, 2023. üëâ The Red Cross said Saturday it was "appalled" by the human misery unleashed by the war between Hamas and Israel, saying its volunteers would not abandon those who needed them most. It called on both sides to abide by international humanitarian law, protect civilians and allow humanitarian organizations to alleviate the growing levels of suffering. "The International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement is appalled to see the human misery that has unfolded over the last week in Israel and Gaza," with civilians paying the highest price, a statement said. Thousands of Palestinians sought refuge Saturday after Israel warned them to evacuate the northern Gaza Strip ahead of an expected ground offensive against Hamas, one week after the deadliest attack in Israel's history. "Nothing can justify the horrific loss of civilian lives in Israel last weekend... but such tragedy cannot in turn justify the limitless destruction of Gaza," the Red Cross statement said. "We are deeply alarmed by the call for relocation in Gaza. Our volunteers refuse to leave and abandon those who need them most. They must be protected -- so that they can protect others." The joint statement was issued by the heads of both branches of the Red Cross Movement: Jagan Chapagain of the IFRC and Robert Mardini of the ICRC. (Reuters/AFP) https://www.voanews.com/a/red-cross-appalled-by-human-misery-of-israel-hamas-war-/7311149.html

DON'T KILL THE LOVE Many relationships and marriages end too soon, due to the couple's behaviour, actions, attitudes, etc. They stop sowing into the relationship and expect to harvest. They don't put into the relationship the same amount of effort, energy, passion, resources, interest, time to keep it as they did to earn the relationship. They end up blaming it on the words 'love' and ‚Äòcompatibility‚Äô. Love does not start on its own. The way it starts is the same way it is killed, by the actions of the couple but this time using unkind words, neglecting each other, turning their back on themselves. By empty assurances and pledges, being selfish and self-centered. By becoming impatient, proud and arrogant. Lacking empathy, not listening to each other‚Äôs needs but being critical and criticizing each other, is how they kill the love they share. They kill love in their relationship by not being truthful and honest but rather seeking pleasure in the flowering of lies. The love did not finish or varnish, they emptied it or drove it away. No human being is perfect or without faults so I wonder why people think there is someone out there they can co-exist with without conflict in the name of a relationship and call it compatibility. No matter who you end up with, there will be conflict which should tell you there is no one created to fit you or complete you. Conflicts and misunderstandings are part of a relationship or marriage. Therefore never leave a relationship or marriage too soon because of a few misunderstandings or conflicts if you want to make it work. Rather look for ways to make it work. Affection is greater than your conflict. Before you go to the family or court for a break up or call it quit, book for a counseling session. Because no one knows everything, it is always good to seek help. That is what makes you a better and stronger person. Counseling gives you support. Call or WhatsApp +233201435300. In conclusion, "Work at getting along with each other and with God. Otherwise you‚Äôll never get so much as a glimpse of God" - Hebrews 12:14 (MSG). - Frank Edem Adofoli (Counselor Adofoli) Counselor, ADR Practitioner, Conference Speaker, Author CEO, The Marriage Consult LTD. T. +233201435300

ŒïŒ∏ŒΩŒπŒ∫œå ŒôœÉœÑŒøœÅŒπŒ∫œå ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø | Œ£œÖŒªŒªŒøŒ≥ŒÆ ŒõŒ±œäŒ∫œéŒΩ ŒïŒπŒ∫œåŒΩœâŒΩ ŒïŒôŒú ¬© ŒôœÉœÑŒøœÅŒπŒ∫ŒÆ Œ∫Œ±Œπ ŒïŒ∏ŒΩŒøŒªŒøŒ≥ŒπŒ∫ŒÆ ŒïœÑŒ±ŒπœÅŒµŒØŒ± œÑŒ∑œÇ ŒïŒªŒªŒ¨Œ¥ŒøœÇ ----------- ‚úçÔ∏è"I undertake this struggle with all my soul and with the idea that I am obliged to. I have the firm belief that we should try hard and save many things in Macedonia ‚Ä¶ I am willing to sacrifice everything to convince the Greek Government and the public opinion about this". (Pavlos Melas‚Äô letter to his family. Natalia P. Melas, Pavlos Melas, Athens-Ioannina 1992, second edition.) üîπThe Macedonian Struggle was a series of political and military conflicts that were mainly fought between Greeks and Bulgarians who lived in Ottoman Macedonia, from 1878. In order to strengthen Greek efforts, the Hellenic Macedonian Committee was founded (1903). Its members included many Greek notables, the diplomat Ion Dragoumis and the military officer Pavlos Melas among them. Its fighters were known as ‚ÄúMakedonomachoi‚Äù (Macedonian fighters). The rioting in Macedonia, especially the death in action of Pavlos Melas (1904), caused intense nationalistic feelings in Greece and led to the decision to send more volunteers to reinforce and better organise the armed bands. Though the conflict largely ceased by the Young Turk Revolution (1908), it continued as a low intensity insurgency until the Balkan Wars (1912-1913). üñºThe Macedonian Struggle. The leader Kostas Garefis with his Macedonian fighters (Makedonomachoi). Chromolithography. So here‚Äôs the thing. I think Daughter of the Empire by Raymond E. Feist and Janny Wurts is brilliant. I loved the original Riftwar Saga, but felt it had areas to improve on, particularly in that I wanted more focus on the female characters and how the Tsurani were sorely missed in the latter two books. This book manages to address a lot of those issues I had and then some. Mara is perhaps one of the most complex characters I‚Äôve read all year and following her journey was full of so many twists and turns that I can see why so many people hold this series in such high regard. However, I will say that the way a certain conflict during the climax is resolved felt a bit‚Ä¶ contrived. I won‚Äôt go too much into it here, but for a story where I couldn‚Äôt predict where it was going, that part felt a bit unearned. Maybe I‚Äôm misremembering the way the magic in this world works, but it felt a bit unearned. Regardless, I think that the middle section having to do with Mara and her husband has to be some of the best, most tragic writing I‚Äôve read in a while. Sets up what could have been and then rips you out heart out, I love it. Overall, a fantastic book, but the ending did make me less eager to jump into the next book, but no doubt that I will continue. Just not right away. For now, I‚Äôm giving Daughter of the Empire a solid 8/10 and would high recommend people to check it out for this fantastic character. Curious to see how the authors build on the setup of this book. Image description: cover art of the book depicting Mara, the main character.

70 MILLION FOOD TERMINAL AND COMPLEX SA MATANOG : Pormal nang itinurn-over ng Bangsamaro Government ang proyektong ‚ÄúConstruction of Marayag BARMM Integrated Local Farmers and Fishermen Food Terminal and Complex sa bayan ng Matanog, Maguindanao Del Norte nitong Sabado October 14. Pinangunahan nina MP Baileng Mantawil at BPDA Director General Mohajirin Ali ang turn over ceremony ng proyekto kasama si Matanog Mayor Zohria Bansil-Guro , Iranun Local Chief Executives, Representatives mula sa Security Sectors at Barangay Local Officials. Ang Food Terminal and Complex ay mayroong Wet Food Building, Dry Food Building, Administrative Building at Public Food Terminal Building na magiging sentrong pamilihan para sa mga pananim, wet and dry products mula sa bayan ng Matanog at kalapit na mga munisipyo. Ito ay isang pilot project sa pamamagitan ng inisyatiba ni Former Member of Parliament Malik "Jun" Mantawil na pinondohan sa ilalim ng 70Million Pesos sa ilalim ng Special Development Fund (SDF) 2020 ni BARMM Chief Minister Ahod Balawag Ebrahim na pinangangasiwaan at ipinagpapatuloy ni MP Baileng S. Mantawil at ipinatupad ng Ministry of Public Works o MPW. Ayon kay MP Mantawil, sa pamamgitan ng proyektong ito ay mapapabilis ang transpormasyon ng Matanog mula sa Conflict affected area noon o War Zone patungo sa Economic Zone. "This food terminal is a transformation of war zone into a thriving economic municipality" Binigyang diin naman ni Mayor Zohria Bansil Guro na ang proyektong ito ay isang manifestation ng isang progressive governance sa Liderato ng Bangsamoro na nagpapatunay na maalis ang stigma na ‚Äú may karahasan at magulo sa BARMM‚Äù bagkus mapapa- WOW nalang ang mga tao sa pag-ulad ng lugar. Target beneficiaries ng proyektong ito ang mga MILF Communities na naapektuhan noon ng kaguluhan sa Camp Abubakar. -End Yanie Abdulrasid, Bandera News TV Cotabato

Hebrew Igbo, are we Igbos one of the lost tribes of Israel? Cultural Evidence! The Igbos history uncannily parallels much of Jewish history in so many ways. Coincidence? I don‚Äôt think so. ‚ÄúBy placing the Igbos alongside other lost tribes of Israel in history, serious effort is being made here at the Almighty‚Äôs work, at helping to realize His word or promise of gathering back the scattered people of Israel from all four corners of the earth, and of restoring their fortunes (see Deut. 30:3-5; Jer. 32:26-42).‚Äù ‚Äì Prof. O. Alaezi 12.10.2023 Who are the Jews or the Jewish people? The Jews or the Jewish people, are an ethnoreligious group originating from the ancient Hebrews or Israelites, and whose traditional religion is Judaism. Jewish ethnicity, religion and community are highly interrelated, as Judaism is an ethnic religion, although not all Jews follow it. Despite this, practicing Jews regard individuals who formally converted to Judaism as part of the community. The Jewish people trace their origins to the Israelites, a people that emerged from within the Canaanite population to establish the Iron Age kingdoms of Israel and Judah. Judaism emerged from Yahwism, the religion of the Israelites, by the late 6th century BCE, with a theology considered by religious Jews to be the expression of a covenant with God established with the Israelites, their ancestors. The Babylonian captivity of Judahites following their kingdom's destruction, the movement of Jewish groups around the Mediterranean in the Hellenistic period, and subsequent periods of conflict and violent dispersion, such as the Jewish‚ÄìRoman wars, gave rise to the Jewish diaspora. The Jewish diaspora is a wide dispersion of Jewish communities across the world that have maintained their sense of Jewish history, identity and culture. In the following millennia, Jewish diaspora communities coalesced into three major ethnic subdivisions according to where their ancestors settled: the Ashkenazim (Central and Eastern Europe), the Sephardim (initially in the Iberian Peninsula), and the Mizrahim (Middle East and North Africa). Prior to World War II, the global Jewish population reached a peak of 16.7 million, representing around 0.7 percent of the world population at that time. During World War II, approximately 6 million Jews throughout Europe were systematically murdered by Nazi Germany during the Holocaust. Since then, the population has slowly risen again, and as of 2021, was estimated to be at 15.2‚Äì19.9 million by the Berman Jewish Data Bank, comprising less than 0.2 percent of the total world population. The modern State of Israel is the only country where Jews form a majority of the population. Jews have significantly influenced and contributed to the development and growth of human progress in many fields, both historically and in modern times, including in science and technology, philosophy, ethics, literature, governance, business, art, music, comedy, theater, cinema, architecture, food, medicine and religion. Jews wrote the Bible, founded Christianity, and had an indirect but profound influence on Islam. In these ways, Jews have also played a significant role in the development of Western culture. Hebrew Igbo, are we Igbos one of the lost tribes of Israel? Cultural Evidence: A good detective in sniffing out the truth must pay close attention to body language and culture of a people; this also may give away a person‚Äôs origins. For example, Germans often uncovered American spies by the way they counted on their fingers, where the use of the thumb comes in. By the way people act you can usually guess with fair accuracy where they may come from for example: ‚ÄúYes Ma‚Äôam, Thank you Miss.‚Äù Cultural protocol of the Southern U.S. People of Oriental and Asian cultures often bow to greet one another. Westerners generally shake hands when greeting others. Some cultures like some Middle Eastern and European cultures will kiss the cheek and embrace. These same cultures may spit when disgusted at someone or something. Some cultures have unique hand gestures to relay a message or emotion. Some cultures in the Orient and in Canada require people remove their shoes at the door upon entering their home. In 1789 Olaudah Equiano, an Igbo and former slave who lived in London said in his autobiography that the Igbos were one of the lost tribes of Israel and cited the many identical cultural similarities between them and the Jews. Missionaries when they came to Nigeria were dumbfounded to discover when they came to evangelize the Igbo People that the Igbo‚Äôs practiced many Hebraic/Jewish customs which they could not have learned from anyone else, it had to come from ancient practice of their people from antiquity; for they had no Bibles and met no one with a Bible until the missionaries came along. They found that the Igbo‚Äôs practiced: 1. Eating of animals that meet the Biblically clean requirements as well as the complete draining of blood from the animal as well (truncated)

A large number of residents in northern Gaza have evacuated south, and the drinking water crisis has become a matter of "life and death" The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said today that tens of thousands of people are estimated to have fled after Israel ordered all residents of northern Gaza to evacuate southward within 24 hours late Thursday night New York time. However, the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East stressed that many people, including pregnant women, children, the elderly and disabled people, are unable to leave and have no choice but to be protected at all times. UNRWA makes it clear that "even war has rules": civilians, hospitals, schools, clinics and United Nations premises cannot be targeted. The agency is sparing no effort to advocate with all parties to the conflict to implement their obligations under international law and to protect civilians, including those seeking refuge in UNRWA shelters. The WHO also stated that day that a plane had arrived at Egypt's Al-Arish Airport from the organization's logistics center in Dubai, carrying 78 cubic meters of medical supplies. Once humanitarian access is granted through the Rafah crossing, the supplies will be immediately transported to Gaza to meet critical health needs. These supplies include enough trauma drugs and medical supplies to treat 1,200 wounded and 1,500 patients with heart disease, hypertension, diabetes and respiratory diseases, as well as other necessary health supplies to meet the needs of 300,000 people, including pregnant women. . Given that hospitals in Gaza are either inoperable or overwhelmed, and people's movements are restricted due to fighting, WHO has also provided trauma bags with enough medicine and supplies to treat 235 injured. With these trauma bags, injured people can be stabilized and receive immediate life-saving care wherever needed.

Good morning everyone. A serious post from me this morning. The role of admin is to keep the group informed, chatty and safe. We help Lisa keep everything going and are best equipped to deal with queries about product and all things LHC when the main woman herself is busy designing etc. This is the serious bit. The group have rules for a reason. It is important that these rules are adhered to by all. Lisa and admin have the right to make decisions within those rules. Sometimes posts are not allowed where it is clear that it will cause derogatory chatter. That is against the rules. What we don't expect is for our members to then get argumentative and block admin in hope they can continue to post matters that conflict with the rules. As stated previously, if you block admin you are likely to be banned. We are here to help and support. We do not expect conflict aimed at us and it is not acceptable. For all the thousands of members who are supportive and adhering to the rules, we thank you Thank you.

The Hamas attack on Israel was the latest and one of the bloodiest episodes in a long history of war between Arabs and the Jewish state. UP political scientist Herman Kraft tells Howie Severino that the tensions began in 1948 when, backed by the United Nations but opposed by Arab states, Israel established itself as a state in what was then the territory of Palestine. As Israel, mostly a nation of European immigrants, won wars and became a military and economic power, Arab states sought peace, sidelining the nationalist interests of their Palestinian allies. As Israel prepares for a bloody occupation of Gaza, Kraft advises Filipinos to postpone any travels to Israel, even pilgrimages to Jerusalem, as the war could widen and drag on.

Subject: Important Update Regarding Group Content Policy Dear Members, We wanted to address a recent development that has required us to adjust the content policy within our group. We value the sense of community that we have built together, and we appreciate your active participation. However, we must adapt to changing circumstances and strive to maintain a respectful and neutral environment for all our members. As many of you are aware, recent events in the Israel-Palestine conflict have resulted in an escalation of tensions and violence. In light of this, we have made the difficult decision to no longer accept posts related to this area or conflict or any political discussions within the group. Our aim is to keep the community focused on our shared interests while remaining neutral in matters that may lead to division and conflict. We want to emphasize that our decision is not an endorsement of war or politics in any form. It is our commitment to promoting a safe, respectful, and inclusive space for everyone. We understand that people have diverse opinions and feelings about this issue, but we believe that our group should remain free of political discussions and the potential harm that may arise from them. Additionally, we are taking steps to enforce our content policy more rigorously. We will be actively monitoring the group to identify and remove any individuals who engage in trolling, make nasty comments, or use derogatory emojis that mock the very real suffering of all parties involved in the conflict. Our priority is to maintain a supportive and positive atmosphere within our community. We regret having to make these changes but believe they are necessary to ensure that our group remains a place where members can connect and engage in a respectful and enjoyable manner. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in these difficult times. Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns regarding these updates. Let's continue to support each other in our shared interests and remember the importance of treating one another with kindness and respect. Thank you for being a part of our community. Sincerely, Marian [Owner]

Karen National Union's Official View on the Nationwide Ceasefire Agreement (NCA) addressed by Karen National Union's Central Executive Committee Member and Spokesperson P‚Äôdoh Saw Taw Nee October 15, 2023 We, the Karen National Union, have tried our best to resolve this long conflict that has been going on for many decades in our country. As our final attempt, we made a decision to actively participate in the nationwide ceasefire and political dialogue, using all available resources such as time and effort. However, in the end, the military dictators had violated all the agreements, effectively destroying the NCA and the political dialogue. As a result, we feel that the NCA agreement is no longer valid anymore. The heart of the NCA is clearly stated in Chapter (1) where it says political problems must be solved through political means. It is not acceptable for us when the military itself violated the agreement that they signed off on. In fact, the Myanmar military was already violating various terms agreed in the NCA even before the coup. Particularly, they absolutely failed to comply with the agreements from NCA Chapter (3) and (4). For example, they entered into our territories, Brigade 3 and 5, and started road construction without consulting with us at all as required by the NCA. It was a total violation of the NCA. Then there is plenty of evidence that they failed to protect the civilians as agreed in NCA Chapter (4). Then Chapter (5) on the agreement to hold state or sub-national level national political dialogue, we, the Karen, were able to organize one but other NCA signatory ethnic organizations were not allowed to organize one. Next, Chapter (6) which is about the interim arrangement where the signatory parties must first consult with each other before carrying out the activities in each other‚Äôs territories. The military did not comply with any of the agreements. As mentioned, the military had violated the terms of the NCA again and again even before the coup. Then, when the power craving military staged a coup in early 2021, everything was over. The NCA came to a halt. If you look at examples around the world, every time there is a military coup, the existing constitution is nullified. If you recall our recent history, when the military staged a coup in 1962, the 1947 Constitution went invalid. Then, when the military staged a coup again in 1988, their 1974 Constitution became invalid. However, the same military that staged a coup in 2021 kept saying that the peace process and the NCA are still valid under the 2008 Constitution (which they drafted and approved against the people‚Äôs will). They are just trying fool its citizens and the international communities. That‚Äôs why, we, the KNU, together with two other NCA signatories, Chin National Front (CNF) and All Burma Students‚Äô Democratic Front (ABSDF) had issued a joint statement a few days ago to make our official view known to the public that the NCA has been voided along with the military coup. Today, our shared goal is to establish a genuine federal democratic system in our country. But the main obstacle is the Myanmar military. They have been carrying out terror campaigns with deliberate targets against civilians, killing people, torching houses, wiping out the entire villages, launching heavy artilleries and air strikes. So far, at least 70,000 to 80,000 houses have been burnt to ashes nationwide. In our administered areas alone, there are more than 700,000 internally displaced people, and over 2 million displaced across the country. This has become a huge responsibility on us on how to take care of those massive number of displaced people. Therefore, first and foremost, it‚Äôs absolutely critical for us to first bring down this terrorist military regime. Second, I wanted to stress that we are opposing not only the military dictatorship. We will not accept civilian-led dictatorship either. If the military junta transfers power to another group of their hand-picked military elites as their exit strategy, it is still not acceptable to us. We‚Äôll have to continue to fight against them. We have officially stated such views in various statements already. Therefore, for any meaningful peace talk or political dialogue to take place, the atrocities must be absolutely stopped first. Then, the military must withdraw from the politics and stay under the civilian rule. Then, the issue of justice must be addressed during the transitional period and the perpetrators of the atrocities must be held accountable. Then, the military must agree that the new federal democratic country must be governed by a new constitution accepted by all. Last, the rebuilding of our nation must be an inclusive process where all the relevant stakeholders along and there must be a role of with the international support. Coronation Street star Chris Gascoyne has shared the first details of his exit from the role of Peter Barlow. Peter took centre stage in a huge storyline twist this week as he mowed down Stephen Reid on the cobbles, killing the Weatherfield villain almost instantly. Show bosses have now revealed that Peter will be arrested on suspicion of murder in Monday night's episode (October 16), which leaves him facing some tough questions from DS Swain and her team. While viewers will have to stay tuned to find out whether Peter is heading to jail, this storyline marks the beginning of the end for his time on the Street either way. Here, Chris Gascoyne ‚Äì who plays Peter ‚Äì shares some teasers of what's in store. Were you shocked when you found out that Peter would kill Stephen? "It was Iain [MacLeod], the producer, who told me and I was not expecting it that's for sure. But I was pleased and I was keen to see how the story would pan out. "When I read it, I loved that it kind of came out of nowhere. Hopefully it was not something that the audience was expecting. They knew that Peter was angry and was looking for Stephen, but although he had tried to beat him up at the flat, I don't think anyone saw that last moment coming until it happened. "Peter was one of the few people who was not on the street at that point and then he came out of nowhere." How did Peter get to the stage where he was prepared to kill someone? "What has happened throughout the week is that Peter had got himself more and more wound up, so he was not in control of what he was doing. He was not thinking rationally. He'd gone into some weird place that he can sometimes get into, and he can't stop that. I think that's what has happened there. "He wound himself up to a point where he had tunnel vision and thinks he is being the hero, but was he being a hero? That is where the story goes from here, what was his real intention? I've really, really enjoyed playing this story out and there is so much more to come." Carla had asked Peter to stay out of it, but did that leave him frustrated? "Because Peter felt he was doing it for Carla, he ignored her and wouldn't let it drop. It was too hard for him to sit back and do nothing once he knew what Stephen had done to Carla. "I was surprised Peter managed to last as long as he did. He had put it on the backburner, but it was ignited again as more and more things started to come out. He was determined to find Stephen and once he knew he was back on the street he was determined to get to him. "That said, I don't think he drove there with the intention of doing what he did." How important was it to you that this was kept back as a shock moment? "I was delighted that it was done that way. There are two ways you can do these sort of things ‚Äì you can telegraph it and get the audience on board with what is coming and some people like taking the audience on the journey. "Or in certain situations you can go all out for the shock value and I think that worked brilliantly for Stephen's death. I am someone who likes to be shocked or surprised so this appealed to me." How does Peter react when he's arrested and questioned next week? "He is shocked that he is being arrested and questioned for murder. As the week starts, he is certain that he saved Jenny's life and he can't understand why he is being asked about his motivation for running him over. At this point, that is his frame of mind and he is still feeling a certain amount of justification for what he did." Peter starts to question his own motive and doubt himself, doesn't he? "Yes, when other people who saw what happened start to question it, he starts to doubt himself. He starts to lose control and a whole internal monologue starts in his head. He starts to think: 'What have I done? Was Jenny in danger? Could I have done something different? Would it have been better if Stephen had been arrested?'" Does this story now become Peter's story? "Yes, that is what is great about this for me. This is where Stephen's story ends and mine picks up. Peter is a man who is in deep conflict with himself. At the end of the day, it doesn't matter how it happened ‚Äì he has killed someone. "It is impossible to imagine what that must feel like. Could you ever rest, could you sleep? He actually says: 'I have taken another human being out of this world forever, what kind of person does that? What does that make me?' And he is terrified." How does Peter cope with the reaction of those around him? "This is the other thing ‚Äì he has killed someone that everyone knew and whatever that person did, he has taken away someone's son, uncle, brother. "I think Audrey needs somebody to blame. She does blame him because she believes he didn't have to kill him. But in Peter's world, he thought he did have to kill him because Stephen had killed everybody else and he had a bottle to Jenny's neck. "The truth is, underneath it, Peter took away Audrey's son. So he can't say: 'Oh God, I didn't do (truncated)

October 15 marks six months since the outbreak of the tragic and senseless conflict in Sudan. Sudan is suffering a mounting displacement crisis and significant further deterioration in the humanitarian situation. More than 5.8 million civilians have been forced to flee their homes since April 15, including more than 1.1 million who have fled to neighboring countries. Humanitarian actors are bravely responding, but they are struggling to reach those in need because of intense fighting and impediments imposed by SAF and RSF. The United States remains the largest humanitarian donor to Sudan and we will continue our support for vulnerable populations in the country and those forced to flee due to the conflict. The United States has been clear that the SAF and RSF must immediately stop the fighting and ‚Äì consistent with their commitments under the May 11 Jeddah Declaration of Principles to Protect the Civilians of Sudan ‚Äì allow unhindered humanitarian access, protect civilians and their human rights, and comply with their obligations under international humanitarian law. In the context of a negotiated exit from the conflict, Sudan‚Äôs democratic transition must be restored with the transfer of power to a civilian transitional government. As we acknowledge another somber milestone in the Sudan conflict, we reiterate our support for the Sudanese people and their aspirations for freedom, peace and justice.

WHY CHRISTIANS MUST SUPPORT AND STAND WITH PALESTINE The on-going October 2023 conflict, which is more accurately, the effort for the Israeli state to annex Palestine has been on-going even before the declaration of the Israeli state in 1948. Despite this systematic and violent apartheid and settler colonialism against Palestine, Christian churches and institutions have supported the Israeli side either on misguided grounds or with dubious intentions. In the spirit of letting justice and righteousness roll down like waters (Amos 5:24), the ecumenical youth group Student Christian Movement of the Philippines feels the need to urge fellow Christians to stand with Palestine and condemn Israeli Zionist settler colonialism. The SCMP lists the following reasons: 1. Biblical Israel is different from the state of Palestine The British Empire back then, with the goal of weakening the Ottoman Empire, had promised independence for both Arabs and Zionists, Jews from Europe whose goal was to establish a Jewish state in Palestine, if they resisted the Ottomans. The British facilitated the settling down of Zionists in Palestine without consulting Palestinians. Moreover, the British carved-up the Ottoman Empire in order to protect its interest in Gulf oil and the route to its then-colony India. In the meantime, European leaders were not also interested in ending anti-semitism in their own countries. British politicians like Prime Minister David Lloyd George even believed that gathering Jews in Palestine would trigger the events in the Revelation, a belief that would be inherited by conservative and influential Christian pastors like John Hagee who justified holocaust as an urge for the Jews to settle in Palestine. Thus, modern Israel is a state born out of unjust, selfish, and even anti-semitic geopolitical interests. In Exodus, God chose the Hebrew people, later called Israel, because they were crying out because of their slavery. Today‚Äôs Israel simply cannot inherit the Biblical title because Israel is committing settler colonialism and apartheid to Palestinians, a far cry from the Biblical mandate to establish a community of justice. 2. Israeli economic and political support also comes from literal, genocidal way of reading the Bible Many conservative Christians, especially those coming from the United States who believe that Israeli settler colonialism is literal fulfillment of the Biblical prophecy for the end times, have had considerable influence especially on Republicans, but also on Democrats, and is something that Israeli leaders like Netanyahu himself have thanked for. American NGOs and charities have also gathered money, resources, and support for Israeli soldiers and for Israeli settler activities like illegal Israeli settlements. 3. Israel is a settler colony Zionists are not simply doing migration to Palestine‚Äìit is settler colonialism. Israeli authorities have incurred a strategic and systematic fragmentation of Palestinian territory reflected in the policies and actual actions of Israeli authorities. These include: building walls and guard towers that limit and constrict the Palestinian population, various genocidal actions and other human rights violations against Palestinians, demolitions of farms and homes of Palestinians, real estate colonization of lands ‚Äòassigned‚Äô to Palestinians. 4. Israel has committed unmeasurable HRVs There have been 5,590 Palestinian deaths from 2008 to 2020. An estimated a million Palestinians have been incarcerated since 1967. Gaza, which is heavily and fully blockaded, is considered as the world‚Äôs largest open-air prison. Israel has been called out continuously by the UN and other human rights groups for massively violating international law, including its said recent use of white phosphorus. Palestinians are considered as second-class citizens even within their territory. Many Palestinian communities have been deliberately cut-off from utilities. These verifiable conditions only tell a fraction of the sinful and deadly society Zionists have imposed against Palestinians. 5. Israel has even persecuted Christians The on-going conflict is not a Jews against Muslims because Israeli forces have also attacked Christians and Jews but are Palestinians. Israel authorities have also attacked and harassed Jews who side with the Palestinian cause. Israeli forces shot journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, a Palestinian Arab Christian on May 11, 2022. Even her funeral was even attacked by Israeli police. Additionally, Israeli militants have also desecrated Christian and Islamic holy sites. 6. Israel and the US have systematically poured fake news against Palestinians Fake news such as Palestinians beheading babies and raping women have not had corroboration, but are spread quickly by mainstream media, compared to, for example, videos of Israeli military attacking civilian targets. Israeli propaganda is also built on a million-dollar troll army. The US spreads deceitful and (truncated)
