The Hamas attack on Israel was the latest and one of the bloodiest episodes in a long history of war between Arabs and the Jewish state. UP political scientist Herman Kraft tells Howie Severino that the tensions began in 1948 when, backed by the United Nations but opposed by Arab states, Israel established itself as a state in what was then the territory of Palestine. As Israel, mostly a nation of European immigrants, won wars and became a military and economic power, Arab states sought peace, sidelining the nationalist interests of their Palestinian allies. As Israel prepares for a bloody occupation of Gaza, Kraft advises Filipinos to postpone any travels to Israel, even pilgrimages to Jerusalem, as the war could widen and drag on.

A now deceased 6-year-old Plainfield, Illinois boy stabbed 26 times because he is Palestinian, according to Wills County Sheriff's department. His mother, 32-years-old, was also stabbed several dozen times. Officials say the alleged murderer was the mother and son's landlord. Reports indicate he had recently been convinced of the false online narrative that is being shared by alarmists on the internet. The false narrative is claiming there will be attacks on American soil by "Palestinian sympathizers" during the Middle East conflict. Yesterday, a 32-year-old woman called 911 begging for help. She had been stabbed dozens of times by her landlord. Her child was also stabbed several dozens of times in his chest and body. Officials were shocked the woman was physically able to place the 911 call. Officials arrived at 16200 block of S. Lincoln highway to find the 71-year-old assailant, Joseph Czuba, was sitting outside of the home of the two victims covered in blood. He showed no remorse. When deputies arrived they found a 6-year-old boy, Wadea Shahin, bleeding to death. He was pronounced dead at the hospital. The child had defensive wounds (stab wounds) all over his arms from trying to stop the 26 separate stab wounds to his torso. His mother, also bleeding to death, 32-year-old Hanaan Shahin was discovered with several dozen stab wounds. According to officials, Ms. Shahin fought very hard for her and her son's life. She had serious defensive wounds as well as dozens of stab wounds to her chest, stomach and arms. She is in critical condition but expected to survive. Wills County Sheriff's department said this was a hate crime. Czuba is being charged with 2 hate crimes, first degree murder, attempted first degree murder, and aggravated battery with a deadly weapon. We do not write about politics, or religion on this page. We are inclusive and just want everyone to feel welcome here, no matter what their beliefs are. I have not covered news on the war because that is not what this page is about. We stay away from polarizing subjects. I wasn't going to share this following information, but I feel as if I should now. Last week, Ricky and I spent two nights in a row, until 3:00 a.m. both nights, essentially mornings, reassuring mothers that they could send their children to school in Marion and surrounding Counties. Many of them were terrified of sending their children because they had heard online that there would be an attack on our soil. I spent many hours sending them accurate news, showing them that it was just fear mongering and not an actual threat. After the first day of sending their children to school and seeing everything was safe, they continued to send their children to school and thanked us for reassuring them. I know social media can be scary, especially when many people are sharing a false narrative that is terrifying. We base everything in facts on this page. Anthony Blinken, U.S. Diplomat and Secretary of State, has assured Americans, "There is absolutely no threat to the United States after the Hamas attack overseas." We do not include our own personal beliefs, feelings or opinions. You can always reach out to us if you see something posted by someone in this area or outside of this area that makes you fearful for yourself or your children. We encourage it. ‚ù§Ô∏è If there is ever a real threat or verified danger to us, I will tell you immediately. Our thoughts are with this family. No child, none, should be killed because of online rhetoric. My feelings about any conflict, anywhere, is sadness for lives lost no matter who it is.

IMPORTANT GATHERING UPDATE: After receiving feedback from both Vendors and Attendees we have made the decision to push the Gathering up one weekend to avoid any conflict with Easter weekend. CHILDREN OF LIGHT‚Äî‚ÄîNewton and the Trinity Newton, the father of modern science, served as the President of the Royal Society at the age of 60 and was knighted by the Queen of England. When he died, he was buried in Westminster Abbey, like many outstanding British people. He was the first scientist in human history to receive a state funeral. In 2003, in a global selection of the greatest Britons by the BBC, Newton was named the first. He was a devout Christian, but Newton was also a Christian who resolutely opposed the doctrine of the ‚ÄúTrinity‚Äù. As we know, the Trinity is the core doctrine of Christianity. His views were considered heretical by all mainstream churches at the time. Then why didn't the church trouble him? Not because he was too famous, but because he concealed his views. From his 1.5-million-word manuscript, later generations were able to know that he was an anti-traditional Christian, also known as a heretic. So, what exactly is the Trinity? Why did Newton object to it? Simply put, the Trinity means that there is only one God and that God has three persons: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. The ‚ÄúWei‚Äù of the ‚ÄúSan Wei Yi Ti‚Äù [Trinity in Chinese] does not mean digits but persons, and the ‚ÄúTi‚Äù does not mean the body but the essence. The three persons represent the three forms of existence of God, but there is only one essence. That is to say, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit all refer to God in essence. It means one God rather than three Gods, which is called the Trinity in English. However, there is no such word in the Bible, and early Christianity did not have this concept at the beginning. The 27 books of the New Testament were all written by the disciples of Jesus or the disciples of the disciples. The canonical catalog was not determined until 397 A.D. Therefore, the various teachings of the early New Testament were discussed and concluded by priests, theologians, and bishops. The doctrine of the Trinity also experienced nearly 300 years of development, which became a big controversy by 318 A.D. In Alexandria at the time, there was a very prestigious elder named Arius who represented the Arianism sect. They believed that Christ was a creature because he was the Son of God. It cannot be said that he was both a creature and a creator, or that he was both a son and a father. It doesn't make logical sense. Therefore, the Son should be inferior to the Father. At that time, the Pope Alexander I represented another sect. They believed that the Son was not created and that if God is as the Father is, then the Son is as well. Otherwise, what Christians worship is a creature, which is absolutely unacceptable. The Pope Alexander I dismissed Arius after their outburst of conflict, but Arius gained the support of many local believers and bishops in eastern Rome. The believers supported him with demonstrations, and bishops from other places also wrote letters to agree with him. Things got bigger and bigger, and eventually they reached Constantine the Great. Although he knew nothing about theology, he was willing to interfere with the church and decided to hold a general meeting to settle the dispute. In 325 A.D., the First Ecumenical Council in the history of Christianity was held in Nicaea. More than 300 bishops were present, and Arius was not eligible to participate in this meeting of bishops. A bishop named Eusebius became the leader of Arianism. He believed that Arius' teachings were logical and completely correct. The sect of Pope Alexander I felt that Arianism threatened the status of the Pope, and there must be no compromise. After a fierce debate, the sect of Pope Alexander I won. Everyone knows how they won, so the First Ecumenical Council finally formed the Nicene Creed. The original text of the Nicene Creed states, ‚ÄúI believe in one Lord Jesus Christ, the only-begotten Son of God, begotten of the Father before all worlds; God of God, Light of Light, very God of very God; begotten, not made, being of one substance with the Father, by whom all things were made.‚Äù Most of the bishops signed the creed, and those Arian bishops who refused to sign were declared heretics by the council and excommunicated. Constantine the Great also exiled the deposed bishops. But the combat was not over. After the death of Pope Alexander I, his secretary, Athanasius, became the new Athanasius I of Alexandria and the strongest opponent of the Arians. A few years later, Bishop Eusebius and his disciples succeeded in persuading Constantine the Great, who in turn supported the Arians and exiled Athanasius instead. In 338 A.D., when Constantine the Great was dying, he asked Bishop Eusebius to baptize him. Most of the heirs‚Äô successors also supported the Arians. Until 381 A.D., that is, more than forty years later, Emperor Theodosius firmly supported the Nicene Creed and held the Second Council of Nicaea. Those bishops believed that Christians could only worship Christ, who was indistinguishable (truncated)

PLAINFIELD TOWNSHIP HOMICIDE UPDATE

On 10/14/2023 at approximately 11:38 AM, deputies with the Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office were sent to a residence located near the 16200 block of S. Lincoln Highway in Unincorporated Plainfield Township regarding a stabbing that occurred involving a landlord and renter.
 
When police personnel arrived on scene they located the suspect, Joseph M. Czuba (age 71) of Plainfield sitting upright outside on the ground near the driveway of the residence.  Joseph Czuba had a laceration to his forehead and was later transported to a local area hospital for treatment.
 
Deputies located two victims inside the residence in a bedroom.  Both victims had multiple stab wounds to their chest, torso, and upper extremities.  Both victims were transported to a local area hospital for treatment.  The thirty-two (32) year-old female was transported in serious condition and had over a dozen stab wounds to her body.  The female victim is recovering from her injuries at a local area hospital and is expected to survive this brutal attack.
 
It was initially reported to police personnel that the juvenile victim was eight-years-old.  That initial information was incorrect, and juvenile victim is six (6) years-old.  The six-year-old male was transported to the hospital in critical condition.  The boy later succumbed to his injuries and was pronounced deceased by a doctor.  On 10/15/2023, an autopsy was conducted on the six-year-old victim.  The forensic pathologist conducting the autopsy removed the knife from the abdomen of the boy at that time.  The six-year-old boy was stabbed twenty-six (26) times throughout his body.  The knife used in this attack is a twelve-inch serrated military style knife that has a seven-inch blade.
 
The suspect, Joseph M. Czuba, was treated and released from a local area hospital and was transported to the Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office Public Safety Complex for questioning by detectives.  Joseph Czuba did not make any statements to detectives regarding his involvement in this heinous attack.  Despite the suspect not providing a statement to detectives, personnel were able to gather enough information through interviews and evidence to formally charge Joseph Czuba with numerous criminal offenses.
 
Joseph Czuba was charged with First Degree Murder, Attempted First Degree Murder, Hate Crime (2 counts), and Aggravated Battery with a Deadly Weapon.  Detectives were able to determine that both victims in this brutal attack were targeted by the suspect due to them being Muslim and the on-going Middle Eastern conflict involving Hamas and the Israelis.
 
The Will County Sheriff‚Äôs Office would like to thank the Will County State‚Äôs Attorney‚Äôs Office for their assistance in working with detectives regarding Joseph Czuba being formally charged in this senseless and cowardly act of violence.  Joseph Czuba was transported to the Will County Adult Detention Facility and is awaiting his initial court appearance.

#ChurchTrivia: THE FOUR WOMEN WHO ARE 'DOCTORS OF THE CHURCH' Today, we are celebrating the memorial of St. Teresa of Avila. St. Teresa of 'Jesus' was the first of only four women to have been named doctor of the church. Her ascetic doctrine and Carmelite reforms shaped Roman Catholic contemplative life, and her writings on the Christian soul's journey to God are considered masterpieces. Highlighted in this post are the other three female saints who bear the title "Doctor of the Church", which is given since the Middle Ages to selected holy people whose writing or preaching is remarkable for guiding the faithful in all periods of the Church's history. ‚Ä¢ ST. TERESA OF AVILA Born on March 28, 1515, Teresa was known as a spitfire. She was not satisfied with a mediocre life and was inspired by God to help with the reform of the Carmelite order. Teresa worked with St. John of the Cross (another Doctor of the Church) to reinvigorate the Carmelites and return them to a faithful life of contemplative prayer. Her strenuous work of reform made her the target of persecution from within the Church, which proved to be a great cross for her. She was also a great mystic and her spiritual writings, such as The Interior Castle, continue to provide spiritual sustenance to many. ‚Ä¢ ST. CATHERINE OF SIENA Caterina Benincasa was born in Siena, Italy, on March 25, 1347. As a young girl Catherine had a vision of Christ seated in glory with Sts. Peter, Paul and John next to him, and it inspired her to make a private vow, dedicating her life to God. When she refused to get married, Catherine‚Äôs parents recognized the holiness of their daughter and made a private cell ‚Äî like the room of a nun ‚Äî that Catherine could live and pray in. Catherine eventually became a ‚ÄúThird Order‚Äù Dominican, leading a life of prayer while being active in the world. She wasn‚Äôt afraid of conflict and even traveled to Avignon, France, where Pope Gregory XI was residing and spent three months trying to convince him to return to Rome. Going against his closest advisors, Gregory eventually did go back to Rome and returned the papacy to the Eternal City. ‚Ä¢ ST. TH√âR√àSE OF LISIEUX Born on January 2, 1873, Th√©r√®se was a stubborn little girl who experienced a profound conversion in her life at age 13. After that moment Th√©r√®se drew closer to God and felt called to pursue the religious life. At the age of 15 she was convinced that God was calling her to enter a local Carmelite order, but the local superior and bishop would not allow it. Refusing to be dissuaded, Th√©r√®se was so bold as to ask Pope Leo XIII for permission to enter at her young age while on pilgrimage in Rome. Her actions caught the attention of local leadership, who permitted the girl to become a nun at 15. Her life was hidden to the world until her death at age 24, when shortly after her spiritual autobiography, Story of a Soul, became a ‚Äúbestseller‚Äù around the world and inspired countless souls with her signature ‚Äúlittle way‚Äù of holiness. ‚Ä¢ ST. HILDEGARD OF BINGEN Hildegard was born around 1098 in Germany and experienced mystical visions from an early age. She eventually joined a local Benedictine convent and became their superior. Her life and writings were highly influential. Pope Benedict XVI explained in a letter the many reasons why she was named a ‚ÄúDoctor of the Church.‚Äù The attribution of the title of Doctor of the Universal Church to Hildegard of Bingen has great significance for today‚Äôs world and an extraordinary importance for women. In Hildegard are expressed the most noble values of womanhood: hence the presence of women in the Church and in society is also illumined by her presence, both from the perspective of scientific research and that of pastoral activity. Her ability to speak to those who were far from the faith and from the Church make Hildegard a credible witness of the new evangelization.

Saint Gregory the Illuminator Church,[a] commonly referred to as the Armenian Church of Baku (Armenian: ‘≤’°÷Ñ’æ’´ ’∞’°’µ’Ø’°’Ø’°’∂ ’•’Ø’•’≤’•÷Å’´, Bak‚Äôvi haykakan yekeghetsi; Azerbaijani: Bakƒ± erm…ôni kils…ôsi), is a former Armenian Apostolic church near Fountains Square in central Baku, Azerbaijan. Completed in 1869 it was one of the two Armenian churches in Baku to survive the Soviet anti-religious campaign and the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict and the 1990 pogrom and expulsion of Baku Armenians when it was looted. It is now the only standing Armenian monument in Baku. Early history The church was built between 1863 and 1869 by the design of Karl Hippius, a Baltic German architect.[5] The cornerstone was consecrated by vardapet Daniel Shahnazariants, the bishop of the diocese of Shamakhi, in June 1863. The construction was funded by Javad Melikiants (Melikov), a Baku-based Armenian philanthropist and founder of the city's first paraffin plant. The church was consecrated on May 4, 1869, by archbishop Andreas Andreasian. The Armenian Philanthropic Society of Baku founded a girls' school in 1866 and a library in 1870 next to the church.[3] In 1903 the Russian government's decision to confiscate the properties of the Armenian church were widely opposed by Armenians. The church was the site of a clash between Russian Cossack soldiers and Armenian nationalist activists on September 2, 1903. A group of armed activists affiliated with the Armenian Revolutionary Federation (Dashnaks), led by Nikol Duman defended the church. The confrontation turned violent by night and resulted in 11 deaths and 45 injuries on the Armenian side. On September 15, 1918, the church was attacked and looted by the invading Ottoman forces in the aftermath of the Battle of Baku. On June 11, 1919, Ottoman-Azerbaijani forces sieged the church and conducted a search. After not finding any arms inside, the soldiers shot at the walls of the church. In 1920 it became the cathedral of the Armenian Apostolic Diocese of Azerbaijan and Turkmenistan.[8] It survived through the Soviet state atheist policies of the 1920s and 1930s when all but two Armenian churches in Baku were destroyed.[8] The church was reopened in 1945 and became the seat of the diocese of Azerbaijan.[8] In the 1950s, the church underwest restoration and by 1956 five priests and ministers served at the cathedral. It had a choir,[9] which was composed of 25 people in 1970, when they visited Etchmiadzin.[10] 1990 pogrom and aftermath The large Armenian population of Baku‚Äîaround 200,000 in the mid-1980s‚Äîwas targeted in a January 1990 pogrom during the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict The city's Armenian population was forced to flee. Serious damage to the church was caused by an arson attack on December 25, 1989, but it remained standing. Vazgen I, head of the Armenian Church, wrote to Yuri Khristoradnov, the chairman of the Soviet Council for Religious Affairs, in January 1990 that "extremist Azeri nationalists set fire to the Armenian Church in Baku on 25 December , destroying valuable ecclesiastical books, holy paintings, and all ecclesiastical clothing." Bill Keller wrote in The New York Times in February 1990 that the church "whose congregation has been depleted over the past two years by an emigration based on fear, is now a charred ruin. A neighbor said firefighters and the police watched without intervening as vandals destroyed the building at the beginning of the year."Human Rights Watch wrote in 1995: "Armenians have vanished from the streets of Baku [...] the Armenian church in Baku stand[s] empty." Current state An August 2, 2001 decree of the cabinet of Azerbaijan listed the church as an historical and cultural monument of national importance. Thomas de Waal wrote in his 2003 book Black Garden that the church "remains a gutted shell eleven years after it was burned in December 1989; the cross has been removed from the belfry, now used as a pool hall." He also wrote that it remains the only visible Armenian monument in Baku Jason Thomson wrote in 2005 that it was "transformed into a billiard hall and tea house." The library of the church consisting of 5,000 books and manuscripts has been preserved. In 2002 the church was transferred to the Presidential Library, which is located nearby, and now houses its archive. In 2006 Azerbaijani Minister of Culture Abulfas Garayev stated that converting the church into a library is purposeful because there are not many Armenian Christians in Azerbaijan. Emil Sanamyan, fellow at the USC Institute of Armenian Studies, argues that calling it a "presidential book depository" is more accurate as "library implies public access which there isn't in this case." According to Samir Huseynov it is open to PhD students and other researchers who can get access. The Azerbaijani authorities have presented the church as proof of their tolerance of minorities, especially the Armenians. In a 2021 interview, Azerbaijani president Ilham Aliyev claimed the church was (truncated)

Latest on the Israel-Hamas War: https://isw.pub/IranUpdate101423:=:https://www.understandingwar.org/backgrounder/iran-update-october-14-2023 Key Takeaways: Hamas continued its ground and rocket attacks into Israel, primarily southern Israel. Palestinian militants are continuing limited attempts to infiltrate southern Israel via land and sea. Clashes in the West Bank between Israeli forces and Palestinian militias decreased after peaking on October 13. Hamas remains committed to expanding the war to the West Bank, however. Lebanese Hezbollah claimed attacks on the IDF for the second consecutive day as part of its ongoing harassment of Israeli forces. LH messaging indicates that the group will conduct additional attacks against Israeli forces in the coming days. Iran and elements of its Axis of Resistance are messaging that the Hamas-Israel war could expand geographically into a multi-front conflict. CTP-ISW is closely monitoring the situation to forecast whether such a scenario is becoming more or less likely. Iranian Foreign Affairs Minister Abdollahian traveled to Qatar, likely to meet with Hamas leadership and discuss Iranian financial assets with Qatari officials.

Messages/Letters to TFN: From & by Modou Mboob "The protracted and heart-wrenching conflict between Israel and Palestine will forever persist until the Islamic Nations, the American Government and other relevant stakeholders are willing to change their approach. The sooner global superpowers acknowledge that wars are not the solution in any situation the better. "The U.S. the leading global superpower is in a position to employ diplomacy to ensure every ongoing war is brought to a halt, but unfortunately, instead of negotiating, they invest billions in supporting one side of the parties to the conflict. This will never ever solve the problem! This is not what the founding fathers of DEMOCRACY envisioned and they'll be really disappointed if they were to come back just to see what's going on around the globe today. One must not use force to end conflicts, it only aggravates the situation. Put on your diplomatic shoes and pay a visit to countries going through war and call for an immediate cease-fire!!! This will work in attaining peace. "Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and Turkey, just to name a few - you're in a better position to take pragmatic steps in leading the negotiations to end the war between Israel and Palestine. Your Muslim brothers and sisters are being unjustifiably killed every single day and yet they feel helpless from Islamic Nations that could intervene peacefully and diplomatically to alleviate the suffering of the innocent victims, especially children and other civilians. Is this how Allah instructed us to protect and defend the Islamic Ummah? A Muslim life taken every single day constitutes a reduction of the Ummah and this is concerning! I call on all other governments including that of The Gambia to officially condemn the bloodshed occasioned against the Palestinians. "The UN, AU, OIC and other global bodies, do you think you're doing your best in ending global wars? Something must not be right somewhere. Until we are all ready to genuinely promote peace and frawn against injustice by speaking the truth to global superpowers, especially the United States, we'll forever engulfed in unending conflicts. "Diplomacy is the only sure way through which the world can enjoy everlasting peace. "I have a vision that peace and justice will one day be attained and the time is very near! "Fa Inna Ma'al Usri Yusra! "Best regards, "Modou Mboob, "Concerned Global Citizen."

Hi everyone. I thought I‚Äôd compile together as much as I could on Glorfindel, as one of the mightiest of Elves, and unique in that not only had he returned to Middle Earth from Valinor, he was also active in all the Three Ages of Middle Earth and possibly well into the Fourth Age too. Glorfindel also known as Laurefindel√´ in the Quenya tongue meaning ‚ÄúGolden haired‚Äù was one of the mightiest and valiant of all the Elves. He was born sometime during the Years of the Trees in Valinor and there is nothing known of his parentage except that he had kinship with Turgon. It is this and his allegiance to Turgon that compelled him to cross the Helcarax√´ to exile in Middle Earth, even though in his heart he was against leaving Aman and so took no part in the Kinslaying. Once entering Middle Earth he like other followers of Turgon settled in Vinyamar in Nevrast in West Beleriand just on the slopes of Mount Taras. While conflict continued with Morgoth‚Äôs armies it was after the Dagor Aglareb, the third battle of Beleriand in F.A. 60 that Turgon‚Äôs thoughts were drawn back to Tumladen Vale where Ulmo had guided him a decade earlier, and it was here in this very place that he built the Hidden City of Gondolin reaching completion in the year 116 of the First Age. Glorfindel who had always been loyal to Turgon was awarded chief of the House of the Golden Flower, one of the great noble houses of Gondolin, whose shields bore a rayed sun. His raiment was embroidered with Golden threads, decorated with Celandine and he became beloved by all the Gondolindrim. Having not participated in the previous battles, Gondolin within the hidden valley remained safe. However in F.A. 472 Glorfindel followed Turgon into battle at the plain of Anfauglith and upon the Fen of Serech to fight at the terrible and devastating Nirnaeth Arnoediad, where upon the battlefield waiting for their chance to act they finally broke through the lines of Orcs and met with the guard of Fingon, just before Morgoth was to unleash the full might of Angband upon them, including that of Glaurung. During the fight Glaurung became sorely wounded by Azagh√¢l the leader of the Dwarves of Belegost but was slain in the process forcing their army to leave the battlefield. This did not help Fingon and Turgon on the Western side so the battle went sour and the alliance was failing. Turgon‚Äôs and Fingon‚Äôs forces thus retreated to the Pass of Sirion with Glorfindel and Ecthelion both at the rear but they were set upon by Gothmog who fought Fingon in single combat. However another Balrog came and bound Fingon with his whip so he couldn‚Äôt move and so Fingon, elder brother of Turgon died by Gothmog‚Äôs black axe. Turgon and his host were now in trouble but if not for H√∫rin‚Äôs bravery and sacrifice this day enabling Turgon and his followers to flee back to Gondolin which still remained hidden from Morgoth, all would have been lost. Not much is written here of Glorfindel in this battle but I‚Äôm sure his sword and dirk counted towards many Orc deaths this day. For 38 years Gondolin remained safe but inner turmoils and dark deeds where upon Maeglin, having been captured by Morgoth, tortured and promised to have both the city and Idril who he secretly loved, gave away the city‚Äôs secret location. So it was in the year 510 Morgoth attacked Gondolin. Glorfindel was ordered to defend the Great Market area on the Eastern side of the city from advancing Orcs. His plan was to flank this invading army but he and his guard became ambushed. Surrounded by Orcs led by Balrogs they fought for hours until a fire-drake came at them and they had no choice but to retreat with the few survivors they had left. This dragon levelled this entire area with flame burning everything, all of its stores and wears. Turgon sent forth his Host of the Harp to help them but instead their leader Salgant in his cowardice led his men to the Lesser Market where he lived. There his soldiers started to fret and feared for Glorfindel‚Äôs safety, so they abandoned their leader. They arrived to aid Glorfindel in time but many of them perished within the fires that engulfed this area. Arriving at the city‚Äôs centre, The Square of the Palace, where great fountains had been built here to add to the beauty of this part of the city, they took refuge. Ecthelion who was Warden of the Great Gate was wounded and Galdor, Lord of the Folk of the Tree, was still engaged in battle which had enabled Tuor to bring Ecthelion here and Egalmoth, Lord of the Heavenly Arch had still to arrive. Glorfindel thus joined Tuor in defending the Square. They fought valiantly but could not prevent the Dragon that came upon them, breaking through their line of defence followed by Orcs and Balrogs including among this dark host, Gothmog. Ecthelion although wounded fought this threat so the others may find time to escape and in so doing killed Gothmog, Lord of Balrogs, but in the process he too was slain. Turgon ordered those that survived to follow Tuor (truncated)

text: Too many Christian churches promote white Christian nationalism over and against the teachings of Jesus. In a time of war and conflict, the pastors in these churches fail to see the image of God in either neighbors or strangers. ‚ÄúThe whole concept of the imago Dei, as it is expressed in Latin, the ‚Äòimage of God,‚Äô is the idea that all men have something within them that God injected. Not that they have substantial unity with God, but that every man has a capacity to have fellowship with God. And this gives him a uniqueness, it gives him worth, it gives him dignity. And we must never forget this as a nation: there are not gradations in the image of God‚Ä¶ We will know one day that God made us to live together as brothers and to respect the dignity and worth of every man.‚Äù - The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Jews are created in the image of God. Palestinians are created in the image of God. Both are of sacred worth, and both have a right to live free from fear, terror, and oppression. If we cannot see that, we are blind. Peace be with you. AVAILABLE FOR ADOPTION - Kenzo von Kempfeld Kenzo von Kempfeld is a beautiful 2-3 year old German Shepherd. This boy is thriving and is looking to make even more paw steps forward with training and guidance. He learns so much so quickly, having mastered ‚Äúpaw‚Äù and ‚Äúdown‚Äù in addition to ‚Äúsit‚Äù and walking beautifully on a leash. He craves work and, if he was a person, would love Mondays and always stay late at the office. However, this extra-large boy does know how to use his time off. He adores being pet and lying by your feet. At the rescue, he sometimes hangs out in the office and mostly lounges on his bed. Kenzo has an affinity for squeaky toys and treats given with an open palm. He‚Äôs not so much a fan of pushy male dogs or of cats. Ever a cool dude, he prefers to avoid conflict, spending playgroups greeting, mingling and hoping for a treat (or four). This medium/high-energy boy is bound to be the star of obedience classes and chill movie nights. His dreams are even bigger than his ears ‚Äî make his dreams come true and come by to shake his paw hello. https://sheprescue.org/Kenzo%20von%20Kempfeld.html With an approved application, you can meet Kenzo at the rescue on adoption days. A noise shall come even to the ends of the earth; for the Lord hath a controversy with the nations, he will plead with all flesh; he will give them that are wicked to the sword, saith the Lord. Jeremiah 25:31. Mar 296.1
For six thousand years the great controversy has been in progress; the Son of God and His heavenly messengers have been in conflict with the power of the evil one, to warn, enlighten, and save the children of men. Now all have made their decisions; the wicked have fully united with Satan in his warfare against God. The time has come for God to vindicate the authority of His downtrodden law. Now the controversy is not alone with Satan, but with men. ‚ÄúThe Lord hath a controversy with the nations‚Äù; ‚ÄúHe will give them that are wicked to the sword.‚Äù Mar 296.2
The mark of deliverance has been set upon those ‚Äúthat sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done.‚Äù Now the angel of death goes forth, represented in Ezekiel‚Äôs vision by the men with the slaughtering weapons, to whom the command is given: ‚ÄúSlay utterly old and young, both maids, and little children, and women: but come not near any man upon whom is the mark; and begin at my sanctuary.‚Äù Says the prophet: ‚ÄúThey began at the ancient men which were before the house.‚Äù Ezekiel 9:1-6. The work of destruction begins among those who have professed to be the spiritual guardians of the people. The false watchmen are the first to fall. There are none to pity or to spare. text: Dear God, Our world is torn apart by conflict and bloodshed. Please bless us in seeing the humanity in one another and accepting diversity with love and understanding. Please bring peace to the world that can only be found in you. I pray for people who are suffering as a result of war and violence. I hope for both physical and mental healing for them. I pray for an end to these wars and acts of bloodshed. I pray for your redemption. I pray for an end to all divisions between individuals, groups, and nations. I am praying for your recovery. I pray for an end to the anguish and pain. I ask for your love to rule over everything. Please Lord forgive our sin and offer peace and healing to our wounded earth. Please lead us from despair to hope, and from fear to faith. Bring us from hatred to love, from conflict to harmony; fill our hearts, our world, and the entire cosmos with peace. We love you ‚ô•Ô∏è - #ChoitalykRuman #inspirationalquotes #motivationalquotes #spiritualquotes #spirituality #seekingpeace

DSWD distributes livelihood grants to 225 former rebels in South Cotabato Koronadal City - "Pagkatapos ng programang ito, hindi na kayo tatawaging mga former rebels, kundi mga negosyante. Narito ang pamahalaan upang sumuporta at tulungan kayo pati na rin ang inyong pamilya," These were the encouraging words of DSWD XII Regional Director Loreto Jr. V. Cabaya during his message at the Former Rebel (FR) Summit held in Koronadal City recently. The event was attended by 225 qualified former rebels who were endorsed by Enhanced Comprehensive Local Integration Program (ECLIP) South Cotabato. The FRs received a P20,000 livelihood settlement grant from DSWD's Sustainable Livelihood Program, which they can use as start-up capital. The summit was made possible through the partnership of DSWD XII, ECLIP South Cotabato, the Armed Forces of the Philippines, Municipal and Provincial Task Force ELCAC, and other agencies such as DOLE, TESDA, DepEd-ALS, provincial population and agriculture offices. One of the FRs from Lake Sebu expressed her gratitude, "Nagpapasalamat kami sa kabutihan ng ating gobyerno. Kaya tayong mga dating rebelde, lagi nating tatandaan ito, at ingatan ang ibinigay sa ating pag-asa para sa ating pamilya." The program provides livelihood to conflict-affected and vulnerable areas as a contribution to Executive Order No. 70, which seeks to institutionalize the Whole-of-Nation Approach. This approach is designed to facilitate collective participation and action in harmonizing government development efforts and services, with the ultimate goal of supporting and pursuing the country's peace agenda. #BawatBuhayMahalagaSaDSWD #SustainableLivelihoodProgram

According to Lt. Col. Rolando Granados, Deputy Chief for Civil-Military Operation officer said that, "The purpose of this activity is to have a football clinic. Stephen Cabanlet who was the co-founder of Football for Peace reiterated the objective of the program saying, "Football becoming an instrumental force in overcoming conflict and bringing communities together in unity for peace and development especially in Mindanao. We are here today to promote football and hopefully one day to establish a Sulu Football Association and we are fully committed to support you." Among the highlights of the activity were the ceremonial kick-off and awarding ceremony of the football champions and most valuable players. In his remarks, Maj. Gen. Ignatius N. Patrimonio, Commander of the 11th Infantry Division and Joint Task Force expressed his profound gratitude to the Football for Peace Movement Inc. for officiating the event saying, "Nagpapasalamat kami sa Football for Peace Movement Inc. sa pagbibigay ng oras sa ating mga kabataan dito sa Sulu upang maturuan at umaasa kami sa mga grupo ng mga kabataang ito ay makapili tayo ng mga magagaling na football players. This is a good avenue to promote peace through sports." The activity was graced by Sulu Governor Abdusakur M. Tan; 1st District Congressman Samier Tan; Brig. Gen. Christopher C. Ministering: Pst. Korede Komaiya Message Title: Power For Total Restoration(Pt. II) Message Text: Isaiah 61:7(NKJV) By the principle of the kingdom, a believer is to recover all. When you are not empowered you will be limited. Unforgiveness creates conflict and hindrance between you and God, it also destroys the relationship between you and God. unforgiveness pitches you against your helpers. Forgiveness is the master key to a life of power. The sign that somebody knows God is that they forgive quickly. Every time you ask God for mercy, He tells you to forgive first. Unforgiveness causes grace failure and it will hurt you much more than the devil ever will. Unforgiveness makes you suffer disgrace in the midst of grace. If you can‚Äôt forgive, it shows you don‚Äôt know God because Christianity is built on forgiveness. Unforgiveness wastes offerings and sacrifices and empowers poverty. Unforgiveness blocks your access to financial favour. Unforgiven conflicts between one another lead to conflicts between you and God. Nobody prospers with bitterness and nobody is worth hating. Unforgiveness blocks your eyes to anything good in someone. You have goodwill for someone, willing to see and reconcile with the person, never gossiping or recounting their offence, never publicising the issue again, showing kindness, and thinking and speaking positively about the person who offended you are all signs of forgiveness. When you continue doing and living the way you used to do, and are never cold towards the person, it shows that you have truly forgiven them. #TMPService #PowerForTotalRestoration #DoubleRestoration #October2023 #OpenHeaven

In 1963, Indonesia invaded West Papua, the western half of the island of New Guinea. Both countries were once colonized by the Netherlands. The United States brokered a deal with the Dutch and the UN to hand over West Papua to Indonesia. This deal was made due to Cold War politics and absent consultation with West Papuans. In 1969, Indonesia and the UN oversaw the rigged Act of Free Choice ‚Äúreferendum‚Äù in which 1000 selected ‚Äúrepresentatives‚Äù voted to formalize Indonesian rule. The ‚Äúrepresentatives‚Äù were threatened with death if they opposed annexation by Indonesia. West Papuans call the ‚Äúreferendum‚Äù the ‚ÄúAct of No Choice.‚Äù West Papua is rich in natural resources. It is home to one of the biggest gold and copper mines in the world. The Grasberg mine, partly owned by American mining company Freeport McMoRan, has caused grave environmental damage. Indonesian security forces respond with violence to any opposition to the mine‚Äôs operation and other ‚Äúeconomic development‚Äù projects. Due to migration from Java and other parts of Indonesia, 50% of the West Papuan population is now non-Indigenous. Non-Papuans dominate the local economy and politics. Indonesia expropriates and exploits West Papuan land. Mining, deforestation, and internal colonization have led to West Papuans losing their land, traditional livelihoods, and autonomy. There is strong support for the Free Papua Movement (OPM). However, support for West Papuan independence is criminalized under Indonesian law. The Indonesian government has designated the OPM and other separatists as ‚Äúterrorists,‚Äù and has increased its military presence in West Papua. Since 1969, the Indonesian military has committed genocide against West Papuans. It is estimated that the military has killed up to 500,000 West Papuans since their war for independencebegan. The Indonesian army commits systematic atrocities against West Papuans that amount to genocide. They include massacres, torture, sexual assault, and detention of political prisoners. In April 2021, the West Papua Liberation Army killed an Indonesian general. Between April and November 2021, Indonesian forces carried out systematic extrajudicial killings and torture. It forcibly displaced at least 5,000 West Papuans. The UN has reported that since 2018 the number of internally displaced Papuans has grown to 60,000 to 100,000 people. The Indonesian government severely restricts journalists‚Äô and human rights workers‚Äô access to West Papua. In 2020, Indonesia passed a law to restrict internet services and to authorize arrests of journalists for publishing ‚Äúprohibited content.‚Äù Indonesia controls the narrative of conflict in West Papua. It portrays separatists as criminal terrorists to justify its military‚Äôs genocidal campaign. The UN has reported that Indonesian authorities obstruct the delivery of humanitarian aid to displaced Papuans. Indonesia‚Äôs abuse of human rights and its use of dehumanizing racist hate speech against West Papuans represent Stage 3: Discrimination, and Stage 4: Dehumanization. The Indonesian Army‚Äôs massacres, torture, sexual assault, forced displacement, and obstruction of humanitarian aid amounts to Stage 9: Extermination. Indonesia‚Äôs denial of access to West Papua to journalists and human rights groups constitutes Stage 10: Denial. #UnitedStatesOfAfrica #AfrikaForWestPapua #StandWithWestPapua

I have today asked the Clergy to pray for peace in the country and the world at large.While attending a Church Service at St. Francis of Assisi, Chwele Sub-Parish Catholic Church in Kabuchai constituency, where I presided over a fundraising event for a church construction project, I have this morning expressed my concerns about the potential global impact of the ongoing war between Hamas and Israel which could affect Kenya's cost of living. Global peace is paramount for constructive development. I therefore, appeal to world leaders to intervene and put an end to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. I hence urge both parties to seek an amicable solution and respect human rights in their pursuit of peace. As a leader and a former Kenyan foreign affairs minister, I am deeply concerned about the ongoing conflict between Hamas and Israel. We call upon the combatants to lay down their arms, engage in dialogue within the framework of international multilateral bodies like the United Nations, and work towards global peace. We are observing a ticking time bomb that could spread to other parts of the world, with potential repercussions for Kenya and beyond, including the rise of other organized groups causing havoc. I commend the progress in the ongoing bipartisan talks at the Bomas of Kenya and await to receive the report in Parliament and proceed according to the decisions reached by Members of Parliament. Hon. Catherine Wambilianga, the County MP for Bungoma County, is representing the Ford Kenya Party at the talks and we are assured of her confidence in airing the views of the party. As we approach the examination season, I ask the church to pray for our children and ask for support for all candidate for optimal performance in their examinations. I also ask stakeholders in the education sector to ensure fairness during the assessment process, allowing deserving students to receive their well-earned results. I am happy and looking forward for the construction of a modern referral hospital in the Sichei area which will enhance healthcare services and provide educational opportunities for institutions like Kibabii University, as well as create job opportunities. In was in the company of the Health Cabinet Secretary, Dr. Susan Nakhumicha, area MP Majimbo Kalasinga, local MCAs, and leaders from the county government.

It's 38 years since the release of ‚ÄòLive After Death‚Äô.

#LiveAfterDeath is Iron Maiden's first live album since the 1981 Maiden Japan EP. Most critics agree that Live After Death is one of the best live metal albums of all time. Maiden has always been a "live" band whose power and energy seemed to come really alive on stage, and this power and energy virtually explodes out of the album. The mixing is absolutely superb. Murray's guitar is on the left and Smith's on the right, and each can be clearly and distinctly heard but at the same time they both seem to blend together and complement each other. This album must definitely be experienced with good headphones! 

The concert intro, with the sounds of aircraft engines and the voice of Churchill, fits perfectly well to the first song of the set. 'Aces High' is a song about the battle of Britain and Churchill's speech was pronounced on 4th June 1940, at the beginning of the conflict, encouraging British resistance in the face of a potential Nazi invasion after the rout experienced by the British and French troops at the Battle of Dunkirk (26 May ‚Äì 3 June, 1940). 

Live After Death was released as a double-LP, which was too long to fit on a single CD. Consequently, the last five tracks ('Wrathchild', 'Children Of The Damned', '22 Acacia Avenue', 'Die With Your Boots On', and 'Phantom Of The Opera') were not included on the original CD release. This was a major complaint. Those live versions are rare and brilliant, and should have been included, even if it meant a double-CD. At the very least, the extra tracks should have been released as a bonus disc. 

The mistake was eventually corrected. Live After Death was re-released in September 1998 as a double-CD, and the second CD contained the five missing tracks from the Hammersmith show. Also, the gaps between some of the songs that previously existed have been smoothed out with crowd noise, improving the album's sense of continuity. And finally, the 'Churchill's Speech' intro is a separate track on this re-release. 

A little piece of trivia: many Maiden fans are a bit too young to know this ‚Äì or are not familiar with British culture ‚Äì but when Bruce, just before 'Revelations', says, "Nice to see you, to see you is nice", he's actually quoting another Bruce ‚Äì Bruce Forsyth, a British TV entertainer famous for his catchphrases. Forsyth was hosting The Generation Game in the 1970s and was known for saying this particular sentence at the beginning of the show.

For more commentary, visit us at www.ironmaidencommentary.com.

#IronMaiden #IronMaidenCommentary #IMC
The South African Zionist Federation has called on the South African government not to take sides in the Middle East conflict.

Greetings from Washington, D.C. I‚Äôm still coming down from a high from last night after hearing Joe Biden address the crowd at the Human Rights Campaign annual gala dinner, as we chanted, ‚ÄúFour more years!‚Äù His has been the most pro-LGBTQ+ administration in the history of our country, and we were proud to endorse Biden/Harris for 2024 and to continue our work to see this equality-focused administration return for another term.

One moment that struck me in particular was when President Biden tied in what is going on in the larger world to what is going on here at home:

‚ÄúFolks, we have to reject hate in every form. Because history has taught us again and again, antisemitism, islamophobia, homophobia, transphobia, they‚Äôre all connected. Hate toward one group left unanswered opens the door for more hate toward more groups, more often, readily.‚Äù

I have these powerful words in mind as I look ahead with great trepidation and heartbreak over what is unfolding in the Middle East.

**Israel prepares for a ground invasion of Gaza

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu toured the front lines near Gaza and stated that the Israel Defense Forces were ready to commence a major ground operation at any moment. The visit follows days of aerial bombardments of Gaza to destroy Hamas positions and soften up their defenses in advance of the imminent ground invasion. The attacks and planned ground war are in response to the bloodiest terror attack and mass killing of Jews since the Holocaust, with Israel losing more than 1,300 citizens, and over a hundred kidnapped and taken into Gaza as hostages.

Israel issued an evacuation notice for more than one million Palestinians in the north region of Gaza, which has been without food, water or electricity for many days. As thousands of desperate families stream south, human rights groups have decried the evacuation notice, which they say amounts to a logistically impossible scenario resulting in massive civilian displacement and a humanitarian crisis. Per the New York Times, over 2,300 people in Gaza have been killed in the past week. Hospitals are already overrun with the injured, which include nearly a thousand children. Gaza‚Äôs Health Ministry will not evacuate hospitals, noting that doing so would confer a death sentence on the wounded. ‚ÄúOur moral position obliges us to continue working,‚Äù the ministry stated.

The initial unqualified support by its allies in Europe and the U.S. for Israel‚Äôs right to act in self-defense is now tempered by criticism that the retaliatory attacks have become ‚Äúindiscriminate attacks against civilians,‚Äù according to the president of the European Council. Over the weekend, President Biden stated, while reiterating that the U.S. stands with Israel, ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt lose sight of the fact that the overwhelming majority of Palestinians had nothing to do with Hamas and the appalling attacks.‚Äù

**The conflict threatens to spread

Iran told Israel on Saturday that it does not wish further escalation of the conflict, but also declared that it will have to intervene if the operation in Gaza continues. This would expand the war from a conflict between Hamas and Israel to a broader regional conflict that could open another front should Hezbollah (which is backed by Iran) or any Syrian-backed militant groups join the fighting. Specifically, Iran warned that if Israel follows through with its planned ground invasion, Iran will have to respond.

The U.S. has been warning other countries and groups not to take advantage of the situation and expand the war to a regional one. It has sent aircraft carrier groups to the region as a show of force.

**The U.S. remains without key leadership

Amid the crisis, the U.S. House of Representatives remains without a speaker after Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), an extreme MAGA ally of ex-president Trump, won his party‚Äôs nomination by secret ballot but not by a margin big enough to seal the deal. There is a faction of less-extreme Republicans, numbering in the dozens, who may refuse to elevate someone as radical and controversial as Jordan to Speaker, fearing voter reprisals in their more moderate, purple districts next November.

Jordan‚Äôs strategy appears to be to mount a pressure campaign against the holdouts, naming, shaming and blaming them for their failure to back him. It is unclear how effective this strategy will be. Indeed, it may backfire should the more moderate members push back against the strong arm tactics.

Meanwhile, paralysis in the Senate, due to holds on military and diplomatic appointments and promotions placed mainly by Sens. Rand Paul (R-KY) and Tommy Tuberville (R-AL), continues to leave the U.S. without key leadership in the Middle East, both from the State Department and the Pentagon. Analysts have begun to warn that the terrorism that struck Israel was aided in part by political divisions there, and that the lack of U.S. preparedness might encourage similar terrorist opportunism.

#OTD in 1951, the Battle of Heartbreak Ridge concluded, marking the end of a grueling month-long conflict during the Korean War. Spanning from September 13th to October 15th, this battle unfolded along a winding front line running east to west, a few miles north of the 38th parallel, through the heart of the Korean peninsula. UN and communist forces, engaged in a series of intense and bloody clashes as they jockeyed for control of the twisting terrain. After a relentless 30 days of combat, American and French forces ultimately gained the upper hand, successfully securing Heartbreak Ridge. However, this achievement came at a considerable cost. Despite their triumph, Sherman tanks struggled to advance through the treacherous Mundung-ni Valley, with 38 armored vehicles destroyed and nine damaged in the process. Both sides suffered heavy casualties, with over 3,700 American and French soldiers lost and an estimated 25,000 North Korean and Chinese casualties. The profound impact of these losses resonated deeply with the UN and US command, leading to a strategic shift. They recognized that battles like Heartbreak Ridge, though significant, often came at too high a human toll for the relatively modest territorial gains achieved. This realization prompted a shift toward more cautious and deliberate tactics involving air support, artillery, and infantry, culminating in the eventual capture of Heartbreak Ridge in October 1951. In the first image, taken September 18, 1951, US troops display signs left by Chinese soldiers. #KoreanWar #HeartbreakRidge #MilitaryHistory

SHORELINE DRIVE AND AQUARIUM WAY Contact: Media Relations Detail (562) 570-5273 LBPDMediaRelations@longbeach.gov Homicide detectives have arrested a driver responsible for a fatal traffic collision that occurred on October 14, 2023, which is believed to be intentional. At this time, there is no indication this incident is an act of terror or connected to any international events. At approximately 6:34 p.m., officers responded to Shoreline Drive and Aquarium Way regarding an injury traffic collision involving multiple vehicles and pedestrians. Upon arrival, officers found a female pedestrian down in the roadway who appeared to have been struck by a vehicle. Officers rendered medical aid to the victim until the arrival of the Long Beach Fire Department who continued aid and subsequently determined her deceased at the scene. Additional people sustained injuries as a result of the collision and were transported to local hospitals for treatment; they are in stable condition. During the preliminary investigation, officers discovered evidence leading them to believe the collision was possibly intentional. As a result, Homicide and Collision Investigations detectives responded to the scene of the collision. Detectives determined the suspect, driving a Chevrolet Bolt, was traveling eastbound in the westbound lanes of Shoreline Drive at Aquarium Way at a high rate of speed when he drove through a red light and struck the pedestrians and multiple occupied vehicles, without slowing. Due to the suspicious circumstances of the incident and current international events, the Federal Bureau of Investigation responded to the scene. At this time, there is no indication that this incident was an act of terror nor associated with the current violence in Israel; however, the investigation is ongoing. ‚ÄúOn behalf of the Long Beach Police Department, I offer my deepest condolences to the family of Romelia Aguilar for their loss,‚Äù said Chief of Police Wally Hebeish. ‚ÄúThe violence and acts of terror abroad have generated concern and anxiety throughout our community, and this apparent act of violence has only added to that anxiety. The immediate response by our officers, detectives, and partners from the FBI has been instrumental in this investigation, and while there is no evidence indicating a nexus to the current conflict in the Middle East, we will remain vigilant as we continue investigating every aspect of this crime.‚Äù The suspect remained on scene. He has been identified as Khalid Yagobbi, a 46-year-old resident of the city of Los Angeles. Yagobbi was transported to a local hospital for treatment and then transported to the Long Beach City Jail, where he was booked for murder and is being held on $2,000,000 bail. Detectives will present their case later this week to the Los Angeles County District Attorney‚Äôs office for filing consideration. At this time, the motive for the incident remains under investigation. The female pedestrian who died has been identified as Romelia Cuarenta Aguilar, a 60-year-old resident of Long Beach.

Subject: Important Update Regarding Group Content Policy Dear Members, We wanted to address a recent development that has required us to adjust the content policy within our group. We value the sense of community that we have built together, and we appreciate your active participation. However, we must adapt to changing circumstances and strive to maintain a respectful and neutral environment for all our members. As many of you are aware, recent events in the Israel-Palestine conflict have resulted in an escalation of tensions and violence. In light of this, we have made the difficult decision to no longer accept posts related to this area or conflict or any political discussions within the group. Our aim is to keep the community focused on our shared interests while remaining neutral in matters that may lead to division and conflict. We want to emphasize that our decision is not an endorsement of war or politics in any form. It is our commitment to promoting a safe, respectful, and inclusive space for everyone. We understand that people have diverse opinions and feelings about this issue, but we believe that our group should remain free of political discussions and the potential harm that may arise from them. Additionally, we are taking steps to enforce our content policy more rigorously. We will be actively monitoring the group to identify and remove any individuals who engage in trolling, make nasty comments, or use derogatory emojis that mock the very real suffering of all parties involved in the conflict. Our priority is to maintain a supportive and positive atmosphere within our community. We regret having to make these changes but believe they are necessary to ensure that our group remains a place where members can connect and engage in a respectful and enjoyable manner. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation in these difficult times. Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns regarding these updates. Let's continue to suppo

Unilateral decisions cannot resolve Palestine-Israel conflict: Mirwaiz Srinagar, Oct 14 : Moulvi Muhammad Umar Farooq, the 14th Mirwaiz of Jammu and Kashmir, addressed the pressing #Israel-Palestine #conflict during the grand Seerat conference at Islamia Higher Secondary School, #Srinagar. Speaking to the media persons, #Mirwaiz, as per the highlighted the deep-rooted sentiments shared by the people of #Jammu and #Kashmir, paralleling the pain felt within the #Islamic community #worldwide. The valley‚Äôs top religious leader expressed profound concern over the ongoing #war, highlighting the distressing scenes of innocent lives, including children and the elderly, being affected. He said the silence in the face of such #human suffering was unacceptable. Mirwaiz called for a just solution to the conflict, emphasising the importance of granting the rights of the #Palestinian people and their right to a homeland. He condemned the bloodshed and urged the #international #community to actively seek a peaceful solution to end the #conflict. The issue should be resolved through #dialogue and equitable solutions, rather than #unilateral decisions, he said.

SAVE ME YOUR IGNORANCE AND PREJUDICE It's super amusing that some people label me as anti-Semitic. Allow me to inform you that my two ex-boyfriends, and these are important relationships in my life, are American-Jewish who believe and preach the teachings of Judaism. They and their families are truly wonderful and peace-loving people. During our relationships, I‚Äôve wholeheartedly embraced Jewish holidays and traditions, and I even attended synagogues. My love for challah, matzoh balls, latkes, kugels, gravlax, and falafels knows no bounds. In our relationships, there was mutual respect and admiration. Let me be unequivocal: I STAND FOR HUMAN RIGHTS, regardless of whether we're talking about Israelis or Palestinians. Every single human life, in my view, DESERVES TO BE DEFENDED. If you happen to lack respect for individual human life, that's your call, but please SPARE ME YOUR IGNORANCE AND YOUR PREJUDICE. I am FAR from being anti-Semitic, that I can tell you to your face. I'm fortunate to have Jewish friends who advocate for a ceasefire and oppose the invasion of Gaza. They recognize that Gazan civilians, WHO ARE DISTINCT FROM HAMAS, deserve protection under international law and human rights. I completely 100% agree. I urge those with a platform to speak up regarding the Israel-Palestinian conflict and call for an IMMEDIATE CEASEFIRE. Please appeal to our government and other nations to facilitate communication and peaceful negotiations among the involved parties. Each time you raise your voice, you hold the potential to save lives. We must SPEAK EN MASSE and stand AGAINST war and FOR CEASEFIRE AND PEACE.

PALESTINE üáµüá∏(summary) -Ang Palestine ay lugar ng mga Propeta. -Walang karapatan ang mga hudyo sa Palestine -Ang puno‚Äôt dulo ng pangyayari -Ang Palestine ay para sa mga Palestino -Ang Jerusalem ay kapitolyo ng Palestine -Walang bansang Israel Ilan sa mga Propeta na nanirahan dito ay si: Ibrahim(Abraham),Lut(Lot),Ismael(Ismail),Ishaaq(Isaac),Ya‚Äôqoob(Jacob),Yusof(Joseph),Daud(David),Sulaiman(Solomon),Zakariyyah(Zacarias),Yahya(John). {May the peace and blessing be upon them} Si Ibrahim ang anak nya ay dalawa: 1.Si Ismael 2.Si Isaac Ang anak ni Isaac ay si Jacob(Ya‚Äôqoob) kung saan ang karamihan sa mga Propeta ay nagmula sa kanyang angkan tulad ni Yusof(Joseph),Daud(David),Sulaiman(Solomon),Zakariyyah(Zacarias),Musa(Moses) at Yahya(John). Ang pangalawang pangalan ni Ya‚ÄôQoob ay ISRAEL kaya tinatawag ang kanyang mga angkan na BANU ISRAEL(Son‚Äôs of Israel). Ngunit,nakilala na ang angkan ni Israel sa pagsuway at katigasan ng ulo kung saan sila ang kumakalaban at pumapatay sa mismong mga Propeta na ipinadala sakanila maliban sa kakaunting bilang na mga nanamapalataya sakanila kasama ang mga Propeta,ganito ang pagdescribe ng Quran sakanila. Kabilang sa kanilang pagsuway ay: -Sinuway nila si Propeta Solaiman(Solomon) -Sinuway nila si Propeta Musa(Moses) -Sinuway nila si Propeta Eisa(Jesus) -Sila ang pumatay kay Propeta Yahya(John) -Sila ang pumatay kay Propeta Zacariah(Zacarias). KAYA PINARUSAHAN SILA NG ALLAH KUNG SAAN ANG NAGING PARUSA NILA AY WALA SILANG LUPA SA MUNDONG ITO MALIBAN SA MGA NANANAMPALATAYA SAKANILA. Ang nangyari sakanila sa loob ng ilang siglo ay kung saan-saan sila napadpad sa middles east pagkatapos ng panahon ni Propeta Eisa(Jesus). Ang iba ay napunta sa Europe at America. Sa World War II sa pagitan ng taon 1941 at 1945 ay nangyari ang Holocaust kung saan namatay ang halos 6 millions na hudyo sa Europa sa kamay ni Adolf Hitler ng Germany. Ang dahilan ng malaking galit na ito ni Adolf Hitler sa mga hudyo ay tungkol sa political at religion kung saan ang paniniwala ng mga hudyo sa mga taong hindi kabilang sakanila ay mga hayop o pinakamababang nilalang,dahil nga naniniwala sila na sila nga ang chosen people na pinili ng Allah. Kaya ginawa ito sakanila ni Hitler. Nagkaroon lang naman sila ng lupa sa Palestine dahil naawa ang GREAT BRITAIN sakanila kung saan nirekomenda ito sa UNITED NATIONS at agad naman ito natanggap ng UN sa taong 1947 dahil matagal din nanilbihan ang mga hudyo sa Great Britain. Sa sumunod na taon(1948) ay nagdeklara kaagad ang mga Zionist Jews ng kanilang sariling bansa sa Palestine na tinawag nilang ISRAEL kung saan parang kailan lng yung pagdating nila sa Palestine bilang mga refugees hanggang sa paunti-unti na nilang pinapalawak ang kanilang lupain sa pagsakop sa mga lupain ng mga palestino sa dahas at sapilitan na paraan. Kasabay nun ay inipon nila ang lahat ng mga hudyo sa buong mundo kung saan dati-rati ay magkakawatakwatak dahil sa parusa sakanila ng Allah. Dito na nanghimasok ang mga bansang Arabo at nagkaron ng digmaan na di matapos tapos hanggang ngayon sa pagitan ng mga JEWS at ARABS. Bukod sa conflict na ito ay di rin ginagalang ng mga jews ang mga arabo dahil naniniwala silang mga alipin lng sila kaya hindi sila naniwala kay Propeta Muhammad SAW at madali lng sakanila pumaslang ng arabong Muslim. Bakit? Si Propeta Ismael na kapatid ni Propeta Isaac ay anak ni Hajar na pangalawang asawa ni Propeta Ibrahim na dating kasambahay ni Sarah na nanay naman ni Propeta Isaac na unang asawa ni Propeta Ibrahim(ayun sa kanilang kasaysayan). At pagkatapos ng paghahari ng mga angkan ni Isaac kung saan ang pinaka huling Propeta sakanila ay si Propeta Eisa(Jesus) ay binigay naman ng Allah ang pangako na ito sa angkan ni Propeta Ismael kung saan magmumula sa kanyang angkan ang huling propeta at Sugo na si Propeta Muhammad SAW. Dahil nga hindi nanggaling sa angkan ni Isaac ang huling Propeta ay hindi naniwala ang mga hudyo sa paniniwalang mababa lng si Propeta Ismael kumpara sakanilang ninuno na si Propeta Isaac na anak mula sa unang asawa ni Propeta Ibrahim. Bukod doon ay talagang palasuway sila sa mga Propeta kahit noon pa. Sa madaling salita,ang nangyayaring conflict sa pagitan ng Jews at Arab Muslims ay sa religion at history. Ang Palestine ay lugar ng mga arabong Muslim,at mga nanampalataya sa mga angkan ni Israel. Hindi rito kabilang ang mga sumuway. Hindi sila kabilang sa pangako ng Allah. Tatlo ang umiiral na relihiyon sa Palestine: 1.Judaism 2.Christianity 3.Islam BAKIT HINDI KABILANG ANG MGA CHRISTIANS SA PALESTINE SA KAAWAY NG MGA PALESTINONG MUSLIM? Ang mga kristiyano ay hindi tulad ng mga hudyo,kung saan mas malala ang hudyo ngunit iisang lahi lng sila. Tinuturing din ng mga hudyo na kaaway ang mga kristiyano dahil hindi naman talaga sila naniwala kay Propeta Eisa(Jesus), sila ang nagparatang kay Maria na nakagawa raw ng pangangalunya(Zinah) at si Propeta Eisa(Jesus) ay anak sa zinah kaya nangyari ang malaking himala mula sa Allah kung saan nagsalita si Propeta (truncated)

Jami‚Äôar Tehran Ta Karrama Jagora Shaikh Zakzaky Da Digirin Girmamawa Daga www.cibiyarwallafa.org:=:http://www.cibiyarwallafa.org/ A yammacin ranar Asabar 29 ga Rabiul Auwal 1445 (14/10/2023), Jami'ar Tehran (Tehran University), da ke Jamhuriyar Musulunci ta Iran, ta shirya gagarumin biki don karrama Jagoran Harkar Musulunci, Shaikh Ibraheem Zakzaky (H) da Digirin Girmamawa. Jami'ar, ta bai wa Shaikh Ibraheem Zakzaky Digirin Girmamawan ne a bangaren Ilimin Nazarin Duniya, Zaman Lafiya da Warware Rikici (World Studies: Peace and Conflict Resolution). Da yake jawabi a wajen taron, Shaikh Ibraheem Zakzaky ya bayyana cewa, ya sadaukar da wannan shaidar ta Doktora ga daliban Harkar Musulunci a Nijeriya da suke karatu a Iran, da kuma ga al'ummar Nijeriya bakidaya. Mayor Releases Statement on Israel Attacks In the face of the recent terrorist attack on Israel by the Hamas terrorist group and the imminent ground attack into the West Bank, Mayor Javier Joven has issued an Executive Order denouncing these acts of terror. The Odessa City Council stands firmly against any form of terrorism and condemns all acts of antisemitism. Mayor Joven believes in the power of unity and peace, and he calls upon the people of the world to join together in solidarity against hatred. As we find ourselves on the brink of a potential global conflict, it is essential that we stand as one, promoting harmony and understanding among all nations. In this critical time, Mayor Joven encourages everyone to pray. He understands that prayer can bring solace, hope, and healing to those in need during challenging circumstances. As a symbol of his commitment to this cause, he shares the following prayer: "Lord, make me an instrument of your peace! Where there is hate, I put love. Where there is offense, I put forgiveness. Where there is discord, let me put unity. Where there is a mistake, I put the truth. Where there is doubt, I put faith. Where there is despair, let hope arise. Where there is darkness, I put light. Where there is sadness, I put happiness." Mayor Joven emphasizes the importance of consoling others, seeking understanding, and promoting love rather than selfish desires. He believes that by giving, forgetting, forgiving, and even embracing sacrifice, we can receive and find each other. He acknowledges the eternal life that can emerge from selfless acts, highlighting the value of resurrection amidst adversity. Finally, Mayor Joven addresses those who may be in need of prayer, acknowledging that he may not know their specific circumstances but assuring them that God does. He encourages individuals and all Pastors, Ministers, Clergy, and Congregations to pray this prayer with an open heart, believing that it can help them find what they seek. Mayor Joven stands firm in his commitment to fostering peace and unity within our city and beyond. He urges citizens to join him in praying for peace and hopes that this collective effort will inspire change, deter violence, and pave the way for a brighter, more harmonious future.

MSNBC has quietly taken 3 of its Muslim broadcasters, with some of the deepest knowledge of the conflict, out of the anchor‚Äôs chair since the war began last Saturday. Ayman covered the conflict from Gaza for two years as the only English language reporter in the strip. The moves come as MSNBC ‚Äî like the Democratic Party with which it‚Äôs often aligned ‚Äî has swung into intense solidarity with the Jewish state after the murderous Hamas attacks. That shift has come with heated internal and external objections to anything that breaks with that solidarity, and has come with social media criticism of Hasan, Mohyeldin, and Velshi. Hasan has also been vocal on X, formerly known as Twitter, condemning the Hamas attack and calling attention to the plight of civilians in Gaza. In 2014, Mohyeldin, the network‚Äôs most experienced reporter in Gaza, was abruptly pulled from NBC‚Äôs coverage of the region and replaced by Richard Engel for several days. CNN reported at the time that NBC executives did not give him a concrete explanation beyond citing vague ‚Äúsecurity reasons.‚Äù Semafor reported that when violence erupted in Gaza in 2021, MSNBC executives had privately expressed discomfort with hosts Hasan and Mohyeldin for their coverage. Conservative media has put pressure on MSNBC to shift further toward Israel in its coverage. The criticism of the three MSNBC hosts ‚Äî three of the most high-profile Muslim on-air personalities on the network‚Äî seems vastly disproportionate to anything they‚Äôve said on air. NBC did not release a statement about why it pulled Mohyeldin in 2014. And when I wrote an article about Hasan and Mohyeldin‚Äôs coverage of the flare-up in 2021, MSNBC did not make either host available for comment. MSNBC appears to be avoiding any suggestion that it could be aligned with a view that‚Äôs more centered on Palestinian civilians, and trying to protect itself and its Muslim stars by putting them in the roles of correspondents and analysts, not at the center of its programming.

CULT NEWS: SNP ACCUSED OF STOKING ANTI SEMITISM AS THEY PLEDGE ¬£500K OF TAXPAYERS MONEY TO GAZA HUMANITARIAN RELIEF EFFORT BUT NOTHING TO ISRAELI VICTIMS OF HAMAS ATTACKS Scottish Government pledges ¬£500,000 to relief effort in Gaza. The cash will be given to the UN‚Äôs Relief and Works Agency flash appeal, which is working to support those being displaced by escalating violence in Gaza.The Scottish Government has pledged ¬£500,000 in humanitarian funding to the relief effort in Gaza. The cash will be given to the UN‚Äôs Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) flash appeal, which is working to support those being displaced by escalating violence in Gaza. International development minister Christina McKelvie also reiterated the Scottish Government‚Äôs call for a humanitarian corridor to allow aid to be delivered to civilians. She said: ‚ÄúOur thoughts are with all the innocent people caught in the middle of escalating conflict in Israel and Gaza. ‚ÄúThe Scottish Government reiterates the call from the First Minister and the UN secretary-general for a humanitarian corridor to be established so that urgent assistance can be given to those civilians who are trapped, helpless and cannot leave.‚Äù The call was made by First Minister Humza Yousaf earlier this week. Tamara Alrifai, the director of external relations and communications at the UNRWA, said: ‚ÄúThis generous contribution is an incredibly humane gesture towards tens of thousands of people who are in utter distress in the Gaza Strip. ‚ÄúUNRWA is very grateful for the show of support by Scotland and will use every penny to help alleviate the suffering of civilian women, children and men in Gaza.‚ÄùYousaf has also been candid about his and his wife Nadia El-Nakla‚Äôs fears for her family in Gaza. Her mother Elizabeth and father Maged made the trip last week, ahead of the Hamas attack on Israel which sparked reprisals, to visit family, becoming trapped there. In a tearful interview with Sky News on Friday, the First Minister said: ‚ÄúI do not know, I genuinely do not know if I will see my in-laws again. Nadia doesn‚Äôt know she‚Äôs going to see her mum and dad again. ‚ÄúAnd all we can do is watch the news and look at all the rolling coverage.‚Äù Yousaf also revealed that his youngest daughter, Amal, four, asked him if ‚Äúgranny would be back in time for Halloween‚Äù, and that they had told her she was ‚Äúscared of the thunder‚Äù. They told her that she would be back, but Yousaf said: ‚ÄúWe honestly don‚Äôt know if she will.‚Äù The First Minister also told the BBC he felt that the response from the Israeli Government was ‚Äúgoing too far‚Äù and punishing ‚Äúinnocent‚Äù people. His comments came after he and his wife endured a scare on Thursday after seeing the area where her family live being bombed through live media reports.Ms El-Nakla was able to reach her mother soon after to confirm they had not been hurt. In an emotional video posted on X, formerly Twitter, on Friday by her son-in-law, Elizabeth El-Nakla said: ‚ÄúWhere is humanity? Where‚Äôs people‚Äôs hearts in the world, to let this happen in this day and age? ‚ÄúMay God help us, goodbye.‚Äù Meanwhile, rallies have been organised across the UK in solidarity with the Palestinian people, with thousands expected to march in London. In Scotland, smaller events in Glasgow, Edinburgh, Aberdeen and Dundee have been organised. McKelvie also announced ¬£250,000 in humanitarian funding for Libya, through the Government‚Äôs Humanitarian Emergency Fund, to support their response to flooding that killed more than 4,000 people in September. She added: ‚ÄúMany thousands of people in Libya are also still dealing with the impact of major flooding following dam collapses in the aftermath of Storm Daniel and our thoughts are also with them and their families, as work to provide essential aid, such as food, clean water and shelter, continues in those areas worst affected.‚Äù "NOTHING FOR ISRAELI VICTIMS" 'The SNP Government is sending aid to Gaza... but nothing to Israeli victims of Hamas' Sammy Stein, chairman of the Glasgow Friends of Israel, says the Scottish Government must not risk stoking antisemitism by taking sides in the conflict in the Middle East A leading member of Scotland's Jewish community has called for the SNP Government to be more balanced on the war between Israel and Hamas. Sammy Stein, chairman of the Glasgow Friends of Israel, told the Scottish Express how he and his fellow members were abused by pro-Palestinian marchers at their peace stall on Buchanan Street on Saturday. A video they shot of a young woman hurling jibes about the Holocaust has shocked people across the UK......

Israel vows to demolish Hamas as troops prepare to move on shattered Gaza Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed on Sunday to "demolish Hamas" as his troops prepared to move into the Gaza Strip in pursuit of Hamas militants whose deadly rampage through Israeli border towns shocked the world. Israel has urged exhausted Gazans to evacuate south, which hundreds of thousands have already done in the besieged enclave that is home to more than 2 million people. Hamas, which runs Gaza, has told people to ignore Israel's message. Inside Gaza's narrow and crowded streets, conditions were deteriorating as deaths from Israeli air strikes rose. Bodies were stored in ice cream freezer trucks because moving them to hospitals was too risky and cemeteries were full. With fears of the conflict spilling further, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken continued his tour of Middle East states, seeking to prevent escalation and secure the release of 155 hostages Israel says were taken by Hamas back into Gaza. Arab leaders stressed the need to protect Gaza civilians. "The reaction went beyond the right to self-defence, turning into collective punishment," said Egypt's President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi of Israel's retaliatory strikes. Clashes on Israel's border with Lebanon, the deadliest since 2006, have underscored the dangers of regional spillover. On Sunday, Hamas' armed wing Al Qassam Brigades said it fired 20 rockets from Lebanon at two Israeli settlements while Lebanon's Hezbollah militia said it fired missiles at Israeli barracks in Hanita and had inflicted casualties. Israel said it was striking Lebanon in retaliation, and the U.N. peacekeeping force said its headquarters in south Lebanon had been hit by a rocket. Iran, which backs both Hamas and Hezbollah, warned Israel of escalation if it kept attacking Palestinians. "If the Zionist aggressions do not stop, the hands of all parties in the region are on the trigger," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian, adding that Tehran could not simply stay an observer. Source: Reuters PICTURED: Smoke rises following an Israeli airstrike in the Gaza Strip, as seen from southern Israel. Photo: AP
